full_text: Staff Machine Learning Engineer, Instacart, United States, Remote, Hide job, 1 connection works here, 1 week ago
details:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

We're looking for staff level machine learning engineers to join our team. We work on a range of interesting and challenging problems, from ensuring deliveries are efficient and on-time to helping customers decide what to buy. Machine learning is at the heart of this effort and an essential ingredient in Instacart's aggressive growth plan and vision for the future.

As Instacart grows and takes on more challenging ambitions, we look to engineers to raise the level of execution overall and be technical leaders with both depth of knowledge and broad influence. In addition, they are strong communicators, excellent mentors and effective cross-functional operators.

About The Job
This is an individual contributor role with significant impact both within the machine learning team and on product team(s) you will collaborate with
You will be responsible for technical roadmaps and will collaborate with Product Management, Data science, Product Engineering and Design to shape the overall product roadmap
You will conceive and lead projects while being a hands-on builder of machine learning software components
You will be a strategic thought partner for leaders across the organization on driving business impact through machine learning
You will coach and mentor the next generation of strong engineers on the team
Minimum Qualifications

ABOUT YOU
Have a graduate degree in artificial intelligence, machine learning or equivalent self study and experience
Have strong programming skills in Python and fluency in data manipulation (SQL, Spark, Pandas) and machine learning (scikit-learn, XGBoost, Keras/Tensorflow) tools
Have experience leading multiple projects of varying scope and complexity in more than one problem space
Are a strong communicator who can collaborate with diverse stakeholders across all levels
Preferred Qualifications
Have 8+ years of industry experience using machine learning to solve real-world problems with large datasets
Are a technical leader who is comfortable handling projects of significant complexity and ambiguity
Strong expertise in one or more of the areas:
Search relevance, recommendations, knowledge graph, catalog, or ads targeting
Combining machine learning and operations research to solve optimal routing, inventory management or marketing mix optimization
Fraud Detection, Anomaly Detection and Time-series Forecasting
Instacart provides highly market-competitive compensation and benefits in each location where our employees work. This role is remote and the base pay range for a successful candidate is dependent on their permanent work location. Please review our Flex First remote work policy here.

Offers may vary based on many factors, such as candidate experience and skills required for the role. Additionally, this role is eligible for a new hire equity grant as well as annual refresh grants. Please read more about our benefits offerings here.

For US based candidates, the base pay ranges for a successful candidate are listed below.

CA, NY, CT, NJ

$226,800—$286,000 USD

WA

$216,900—$275,000 USD

OR, DE, ME, MA, MD, NH, RI, VT, DC, PA, VA, CO, TX, IL, HI

$207,900—$263,000 USD

All other states

$189,000—$239,000 USD

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

full_text: Manager, Paid Search, Reprise Digital, Los Angeles Metropolitan Area, Hybrid, $90K/yr - $100K/yr, Medical, Dental, Hide job, 1 company alumnus works here, Promoted, Easy Apply
details:
Position Summary
Who we are: Reprise is among the media industry’s fastest growing digital agencies servicing Fortune 500 brands –thanks to our culture of innovation, excellence, personal growth, and fun. As the global performance marketing agency of IPG Mediabrands, we are obsessed with Customer Flow, the continuous movement of customers along the path to purchase. Our purpose is to help brands build and accelerate Customer Flow, and we offer deep expertise in digital crafts required to move customers along that journey.
Who you are: A passionate and driven search professional, you excel at translating the digital strategy set at the senior level into daily tactical execution. You’re ready to challenge the status quo to produce world-class search campaigns for high profile brands and take pride in your ability to clearly articulate the outcomes of the tactics and the strategy to the client as the day-to-day client lead. You thrive in a multi-functional role and enjoy training and coaching team members to ensure flawless tactical execution.

Key Responsibilities
Works with search director to develop campaign strategies and is responsible for the execution of search campaigns against the strategy
Support meaningful test ideas: soliciting recommendations to client and able to effectively execute and measure
Lead virtual and in-person presentations in a polished, energetic way, displaying story-telling elements throughout
Create and present case studies, POVs, etc.
Display basic management skills, including understanding of setting expectations, ability to train others, delegate tasks and provide feedback
Lead, develop and manage junior staff
Offer guidance support, direction and provide development opportunities and ongoing feedback
Ensure direct reports have received all tools and training to excel in their roles, this includes but is not limited to deal math, sales techniques and excel
Main team contact for questions or problem solving
Assist team with conflict resolution, conference calls and meetings where necessary
Coaches and mentors’ team and makes recommendations for direct reports training/development, responsible for performance evaluations & regular feedback
Manage/training associate on the search team and responsible for overseeing their career development
Liaison between search and all other digital channels to help contribute towards a multi-channel approach/strategy
Works with senior leadership to provide day to day insight on staffing needs
Exhibit understanding and ability to clearly discuss paid search fundamentals (Acronyms, Jargon, etc.)
Lead a day-to-day client and cross-department relationships
Drive client growth through data-drive and qualitative recommendations
Supports business growth efforts by assisting others with proposals, research and data collection
Oversees and manages client reports and analysis
Works with Search Lead to develop campaign strategies and is responsible for the execution of search campaigns against the strategy
Support meaningful test ideas: soliciting recommendations to client and able to effectively execute and measure
Establish understanding of media types beyond paid search and understand how paid search fits into a larger digital/marketing strategy
Have clear POV on best practices for how to manage Vendor Relationships
Express differences on Media Metrics
Supports and drives corporate culture initiatives
Accountable to launch timelines and pacing accuracy.
Responsible for majority of day-to-day client communications regarding insights, reporting, and optimization recommendation. Assists in the development of POVs
Needs to have a strong sense of developing and leaning into processes that evolve workflows
Responsible for starting to connect/drive synergy with larger media plans
Display management skills, including understanding of setting expectations, ability to train others, delegate tasks and provide feedback
Putting together client-friendly search plans for approval

Desired Skills & Experience
Education:
Bachelor's degree equivalent in Marketing/ related field is preferable or related work experience
Work Experience:
3+ years of paid search experience
Skills:
Expert in Google, Bing, and other search partners
Expert on at least one bidding platform such as Marin, Kenshoo or SA360
Have basic story-telling ability as well as ability to lead virtual and in-person presentations
Experience with within an agency environment required
Excellent writing skills with an attention to detail
Expertise with Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint is required
Ability to multitask and handle other duties as assigned
Spanish proficiency is a plus

Why join us
You’ll work hard, grow and recharge. Our diverse business offers various opportunities to grow your career across Paid Search, Paid Social, SEO, eCommerce, and Strategy, amongst others. We provide tools to support your career ambitions that include mentorship programs, learning modules and professional skills trainings. You’ll have the opportunity to drive social impact with our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Council to create meaningful change in our communities.
In addition to working with some of the world’s most dynamic and recognized brands, you will enjoy incredible benefits such as unlimited time off, multiple health/wellness days, extra-long
holiday weekends, various perks, discounts, and benefits provided by our clients and an incredible office culture.
Join us and find your passion within customer flow!

Wage and Benefits
We offer a Total Rewards package that includes medical and dental coverage, 401(k) plans, flex spending, life insurance, disability, employee discount program, employee stock purchase program and paid family benefits to support you and your family. To give you the ability to better meet your personal needs, and in support of your physical and emotional well-being, you will receive discretionary time off days and company-wide Appreciation Weeks and Wellness Days.
We also offer a competitive Total Compensation package, including a competitive salary and eligibility for an annual discretionary incentive award or a relevant incentive award.

The salary range for this position is $90,000 to $100,000. Where an employee or prospective employee is paid within this range will depend on, among other factors, actual ranges for current/former employees in the subject position, market considerations, budgetary considerations, tenure and standing with the Company (applicable to current employees), as well as the employee’s/applicant’s skill set, level of experience, and qualifications.

Employment Transparency
It is the policy of Mediabrands, division of the Interpublic group, to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, creed, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship, genetic information, veteran status, disability, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law.
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
The employer will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the American with Disabilities Act of 1990. The job description will be reviewed periodically as duties and responsibilities change with business necessity. Essential and other job functions are subject to modification. Reasonable accommodations may be provided to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
For applicants to jobs in the United States: In compliance with the current Americans with Disabilities Act and state and local laws, if you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation to apply for a position with Mediabrands, please email accommodation@mbww.com.

About Us
Why join us: You’ll work hard, grow and recharge. Our diverse business offers various opportunities to grow your career across Paid Search, Paid Social, SEO, eCommerce, and Strategy, amongst others. We provide tools to support your career ambitions that include mentorship programs, learning modules and professional skills trainings. You’ll have the opportunity to drive social impact with our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Council to create meaningful change in our communities.
In addition to working with some of the world’s most dynamic and recognized brands, you will enjoy incredible benefits such as unlimited time off, multiple health/wellness days, extra-long holiday weekends, various perks, discounts, and benefits provided by our clients and an incredible office culture.

full_text: Principal Software Engineer, API, Checkr, Inc., Chicago, IL, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 1 alum works here, Promoted, 3 applicants
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

Checkr is looking for an experienced Principal Software Engineer, API to facilitate the long-term design of Checkr’s core APIs and to lead critical cross-organizational initiatives, including driving Checkr’s first versioning strategy. In this role, you will work across the entire R&D organization to deeply understand the product’s domain models and customer needs, and work across all teams to ensure that Checkr is architecting a best-in-class, API-first product that can scale into the future.

Responsibilities:
Facilitate the long-term architecture of our APIs
Drive the work to introduce Checkr’s first versioning strategy
Lead and sponsor API governance groups and advocate for best practices
Deeply understand customer, partner, and product team needs
Ensure the quality, reliability, and scalability of our services
Collaborate with the team in designing and implementing new features
Partner with Product and management in project planning, focusing on timeline and scoping
Evangelize Checkr’s APIs and be an advocate for Checkr in the developer community

What you bring:
5+ years leading API design and architecture projects across an organization
8+ years experience in a leadership role
15+ years experience as a software engineer
Experience in Ruby and GoLang
Strong collaboration, communication and project management skills
Deep understanding of microservices design and asynchronous queueing models
Experience leading and influencing cross-functional teams
A strong sense of ownership
Experience mentoring engineering and product teams in domain driven design
A great desire to learn, collaborate, improve, and innovate

What you get:
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to 25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $223,975 - $263,500 and within the city limits of NYC is $263,500 - $310,000.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr

Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr’s commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

full_text: Fraud & Risk, Machine Learning Engineer (Staff/Senior), Instacart, United States, Remote, Hide job, You have a preferred skill badge, 4 days ago
details:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

ABOUT THE ROLE

The mission of the Success & Protect team at Instacart is to build outstanding products and tools to ensure a useful, secure, fraud-free Instacart platform. As a Machine Learning Engineer on the Success & Protect team, you will be responsible for applying sophisticated machine learning techniques to prevent and detect fraud behaviors. You will also own, build, deploy and monitor fraud and risk defense solutions that benefit Instacart’s business, products and operations. You will work with dedicated and welcoming engineers in a critical and meaningful area. The ideal candidate is passionate about crafting innovative solutions and has a curiosity for solving real business problems.

About The Job
This is an individual contributor role where you will own the detection and prevention of fraud issues end-to-end, including deep-diving into the business problem, prioritizing the problem, defining success metrics, creating new features, developing new models, and productionizing the model with Machine Learning Infra teams.
Work multi-functionally with product managers, data scientists, data analysts, operations, and other engineering teams to define and drive new initiatives.
Contribute to the next-generation ML frameworks, platforms, and infrastructure by working with the data infrastructure and platform teams.
Become a thought leader in your domain, mentor junior engineers across the org, and help the org grow and evolve.
About You

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
2+ years of experience as a machine learning engineer or applied machine learning scientist.
Proven programming skills, including proficiency in Ruby, Python, Java, C++ or other programming languages.
Experience developing and productionizing machine learning models.
Preferred Qualifications
Deep understanding of one of the following domains: fraud detection, risk management, and account security.
Experience with impactful ML experience in the field of fraud & risk.
Experience with data platforms, like Kafka or Flink.
Strong communication and teamwork skills with diverse cross functional partners across all levels.
Passion for working and growing in a fast-growing company and organization.
All other states

$144,900—$239,000 USD

OR, DE, ME, MA, MD, NH, RI, VT, DC, PA, VA, CO, TX, IL, HI

$159,300—$263,000 USD

WA

$166,500—$275,000 USD

Offers may vary based on many factors, such as candidate experience and skills required for the role. Additionally, this role is eligible for a new hire equity grant as well as annual refresh grants. Please read more about our benefits offerings here.

full_text: Senior Software Engineer, Trust & Safety (T&S), Checkr, Inc., Seattle, WA, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 1 alum works here, Promoted, 2 applicants
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

This position is for our Tessera Data business, which is focused on building a safer future, online and offline, by providing valuable people data to drive informed trust and safety decisions. Our industry-leading data serves as the backbone for background checks used to protect a company’s employees, customers, and community. We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join their team that is highly collaborative and cares deeply about the mission of our company, is eager to work with a diverse team of engineers and has a quality-focused mindset. In this role, the Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for integration of the recently acquired background checks solution into Tessera in the near future, working on the data vendor integrations and evolving it into the identity verification platform long-term. The background check solution currently contains several public APIs, public and internal portals, and a handful of microservices. To be successful, this individual will work on integrating the acquired background check product into the Tessera ecosystem and will work on turning it into a solid foundation to build a complex identity verification solution.

We are a team of data explorers that thrive in acquiring, processing, and delivering data to solve trust and safety decisions! Join our team and be part of:
The industry leader in public records data aggregation and data classification/normalization
A collaborative environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally
An environment where your voice matters: Be vocal, we want to hear your ideas
A fun, creative, cooperative, and multicultural team

Responsibilities:
Own the product development from ideation, design, implementation, to release
Partner with the technical lead in designing and architecting new systems
Collaborate with the technical lead and remote team in implementation
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
Deliver performant, reliable, scalable, and secure code

What you bring:
5+ years experience as a software engineer working with .NET
Experience designing and implementing REST APIs
Experience building lambda based applications on AWS
Experience building CI/CD using Serverless, Cloudformation, Terraform or similar
Experience building asynchronous processing pipelines using message queuing systems such as AWS SQS/SNS, RabbitMQ, Kafka or similar
Experience working with both RDBMS and NoSQL data stores such as SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB
A strong understanding of microservice architecture infrastructure, inclusive of familiarity with Kubernetes
A passion for optimizing services for scale and speed
A great desire to learn, collaborate, improve, and innovate

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to $25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to 25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $122,103-$143,650 and within the city limits of NYC is $143,650 - $169,000.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Tessera

Tessera is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Tessera believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Tessera also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Tessera's commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

We're looking for economists and machine learning engineers to join our fast paced Economics team! We work on a range of exciting challenges, from aligning the incentives in our multi-sided marketplace, to analyzing the role of prices and product placement in our customers' decision-making.

This is an opportunity to work in areas critical to our business, like pricing, online advertising, uplift and long term value modeling, and causal inference.

About The Job

On the Economics team we build machine learning solutions, and bring models from conception to production. You'll be part of an outstanding internal community, with the opportunity to share findings, methodologies and research across domains. You will be dedicated to a cross-functional product team, with tremendous ownership and responsibility for directly leading projects. You'll also:
Develop high impact solutions to support Instacart's ambitious growth plans.
Work closely with engineers, product managers, other teams, and both internal and external partners. You'll be responsible for a large part of the process, from problem understanding to recommending a solution and testing it in controlled experiments.
Have the freedom to suggest and drive organization-wide initiatives!
Minimum Qualifications

ABOUT YOU

We're Looking For People With Self-motivation And a Strong Sense Of Ownership, As Well As

A PhD in economics or the equivalent industry/academic experience. A blend of economic theory, applied econometrics, and business skills that let you jump into a fast-paced environment and contribute from day one.
Strong engineering skills, with expertise in Python and proficiency in data manipulation (SQL, Spark, Pandas) and ML (scikit-learn, XGBoost, Keras/Tensorflow) tools
An ability to identify and prioritize high-impact problems and deliver solutions that provide reasonable trade-offs between urgency and quality.
Expertise in causal inference with observational and experimental data
Preferred Qualifications

6+ years of experience in industry and/or academia, preferably working on data-intense problems. Experience training large-scale models and model deployment on cloud services (Docker, AWS/GCP/Azure) will be valuable. Willing and able to travel internationally based on job requirements.

full_text: Fulfillment, Machine Learning Engineer (Staff/Senior), Instacart, San Francisco, CA, On-site, Hide job, You have a preferred skill badge, 2 weeks ago, 2 applicants
details:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we're building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you're ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There's no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it's from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

The Fulfillment Marketplace system sits at the core of Instacart. We build industry leading technology to power a balanced, sustainable and resilient marketplace that efficiently meets customer demand, incentivizes shoppers, and offers a widening range of high quality services. Our engineering teams are world-class experts in systems, algorithms, machine learning, optimization and operations research, working together to drive technology innovations in areas such as routing, matching, pricing, forecasting, incentives that enable best product experiences for our customers and shoppers.

Given the scale and growth of our platform and the combinatorial explosion of logistics possibilities, our system needs to handle billions of computations in real time and provide optimal solutions that lead to the most efficient and reliable way of fulfilling customer orders. We rely heavily on state-of-the-art data infrastructure and online inference architectures paired with best-in-class modeling techniques and methodologies so as to adapt to the dynamic nature of customer demand, available inventory, and shopper supply. As a technologist, joining our team means working on endless fun and challenging problems with a brilliant team that has been central to, and is playing an increasingly critical role to the growth of the Instacart platform.

About The Team

A few project examples: Services & Pricing, Logistics, Dynamic Pricing, Marketplace Balancing
Imagine an on-line shopping experience where delivery options and pricing are dynamically constructed to boost your shopping experience.
We aim to bring such a personalized delivery experience to online shopping. The goal is to let people order whatever they want, whenever it's convenient, for a price that fits their budget.
Machine learning models play a major role in predicting the ETA of delivering an order to any user, the capacity of each delivery option based on real-time shopper supply, and the corresponding pricing of each delivery option.
We work on improving all these models on Instacart to present the most desirable shopping experience for each user, in order to retain loyal customers and gain new customers.
Logistics works on a range of interesting and challenging problems, from making sure orders are fulfilled efficiently and on-time to helping customers decide what to buy.
Dynamic Pricing owns how we pay for work. We pay multi-billion dollars annually to shoppers and it is the vast majority of the spend needed to run our business.
We're working to overcome big challenges, including adjusting in real-time to local supply and demand conditions across multiple countries, supporting massive scale for our optimization engines, and figuring out how to structure pay for next-generation fulfillment models and products.
Marketplace balancing is aimed to optimize Instacart's demand and supply distributions through forecasting, decision making, and balancing levers. Typical forecasting projects include: building ML based forecasting models, tracking real-time demand/supply events, and building scalable forecasting pipelines and systems.
The decision-making system consumes demand/supply forecasts and makes coordinated and optimized decisions on when, where and how to apply particular balancing levers to match demand and supply.
The charter of the balancing levers includes the development, measurement, and optimization of various demand shaping techniques, and supply acquisition, promotion, and engagement channels.

About The Job
This is an individual contributor role with significant impact both within the machine learning team and on product team(s) you will collaborate with
You will be responsible for technical roadmaps and will collaborate with Product Management, Data science, Product Engineering and Design to shape the overall product roadmap
You will conceive and lead projects while being a hands-on builder of machine learning software components in the production environment that directly drive customer impact
You will be a strategic thought partner for leaders across the organization on driving business impact through machine learning
You will coach and mentor the next generation of strong engineers on the team

About You

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Strong expertise in one or more of the areas: machine learning, operations research to solve optimal routing, inventory management, marketing mix optimization, pricing, or time-series forecasting
Have 3-6+ years of industry experience developing machine learning models with large datasets and related production engineering to solve real-world problems end to end
Have strong programming skills in Python (or similar languages) and fluency in data manipulation (SQL, Spark, Pandas) and machine learning (scikit-learn, XGBoost, Keras/Tensorflow) tools

Preferred Qualifications
Have a graduate degree in artificial intelligence, machine learning or equivalent self study and experience
Have experience leading multiple projects of varying scope and complexity in more than one problem space
Are a technical leader who is comfortable handling projects of significant complexity and ambiguity
Are a strong communicator who can collaborate with diverse stakeholders across all levels

full_text: Senior Software Engineer, Trust & Safety (T&S), Checkr, Inc., Boston, MA, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 1 alum works here, Promoted, 4 applicants
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

This position is for our Tessera Data business, which is focused on building a safer future, online and offline, by providing valuable people data to drive informed trust and safety decisions. Our industry-leading data serves as the backbone for background checks used to protect a company’s employees, customers, and community. We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join their team that is highly collaborative and cares deeply about the mission of our company, is eager to work with a diverse team of engineers and has a quality-focused mindset. In this role, the Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for integration of the recently acquired background checks solution into Tessera in the near future, working on the data vendor integrations and evolving it into the identity verification platform long-term. The background check solution currently contains several public APIs, public and internal portals, and a handful of microservices. To be successful, this individual will work on integrating the acquired background check product into the Tessera ecosystem and will work on turning it into a solid foundation to build a complex identity verification solution.

We are a team of data explorers that thrive in acquiring, processing, and delivering data to solve trust and safety decisions! Join our team and be part of:
The industry leader in public records data aggregation and data classification/normalization
A collaborative environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally
An environment where your voice matters: Be vocal, we want to hear your ideas
A fun, creative, cooperative, and multicultural team

Responsibilities:
Own the product development from ideation, design, implementation, to release
Partner with the technical lead in designing and architecting new systems
Collaborate with the technical lead and remote team in implementation
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
Deliver performant, reliable, scalable, and secure code

What you bring:
5+ years experience as a software engineer working with .NET
Experience designing and implementing REST APIs
Experience building lambda based applications on AWS
Experience building CI/CD using Serverless, Cloudformation, Terraform or similar
Experience building asynchronous processing pipelines using message queuing systems such as AWS SQS/SNS, RabbitMQ, Kafka or similar
Experience working with both RDBMS and NoSQL data stores such as SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB
A strong understanding of microservice architecture infrastructure, inclusive of familiarity with Kubernetes
A passion for optimizing services for scale and speed
A great desire to learn, collaborate, improve, and innovate

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to $25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to 25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $122,103-$143,650 and within the city limits of NYC is $143,650 - $169,000.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Tessera

Tessera is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Tessera believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Tessera also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Tessera's commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

details:
We're transforming the grocery industry

Overview

The General ML team is dedicated to building a multi-faceted machine learning foundation at Instacart.

We are utilizing machine learning to develop catalog solutions, including product taxonomy classification and catalog data anomaly detection. We are developing the Knowledge Graph and employing graph learning to shape the understanding of products for machine learning applications. In addition, we are creating content that inspires customers to discover new products on Instacart.

We are looking for machine learning engineers to advance this initiative, establish the foundation for a variety of machine learning applications at Instacart, and serve millions of households.

About The Job

As a senior/staff machine learning engineer on the General ML team
You use your strong engineering and machine learning skills to analyze problems and propose creative solutions in related team fields (catalog, knowledge graph, and inspirational content).
You build the vision and roadmap for your field and prioritize the work that best aligns with business objectives.
You work multi-functionally with other partners/teams to define goals, build alignments and drive projects.
You are responsible for the success of projects in your field and hold yourself accountable for the outcomes of each milestone.
You are a thought leader in your field, mentor junior engineers, and help the team grow and evolve.

About You

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
A graduate degree in artificial intelligence, machine learning, or equivalent self-study and experience.
Extensive experience in natural language processing, knowledge graph, computer vision, text mining, and/or information extraction.
Comfortable with learning and using state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms in the field.
Strong programming skills and experience in Python, data manipulation (SQL, Spark, Pandas), and popular machine learning tools (PyTorch, Tensorflow, Scikit-learn, XGBoost), or equivalent experience.

Preferred Qualifications
Familiar with works related to the product catalog, taxonomy enrichment, product enrichment, graph learning, and/or collaborative filtering.
Strong communication skills and previous experience leading projects with multi-functional partners.
Experience in handling projects of significant complexity and ambiguity.
Strong engineering background and can develop end-to-end machine learning solutions.
Experience contributing to research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in major conferences or journals.

Overview

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are investing heavily in the next-generation of our services. At our velocity and volume-level we need the ability to deploy new products and features faster and better. That’s our choice for the traditional 3-dimensional engineering trade-off decision. Come help to build the best new user experience anywhere. We are creating new architectural designs and new services that couple best-in-class engineering with highly-informed business knowledge.

About The Team

Instacart has a four sided marketplace, and we have roles open within each of our Engineering orgs. In our interview process we will evaluate how your skills would fit within one of these teams, and match you with the role(s) that are best related to your interests and abilities.

About The Job
We work in small teams with significant ownership and autonomy over your project
Design, implement, and ship high quality features with a strong sense of urgency and accountability
Work closely with product managers, designers, data scientists, and peer engineering teams to define project requirements and execution plans
Ensure that system designs including APIs, deployment architecture, and dependency selection result in highly scalable, robust solutions that minimize support costs and improve an outstanding customer experience
Contribute broadly to Instacart’s success by exercising your freedom to suggest and drive organization-wide initiatives
About You

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
A strong sense of ownership
Self-motivation and an enjoyment for a startup environment
Solid understanding of common back-end Web technologies in a production environment
An ability to balance priorities with shipping high quality and pragmatic solutions
Experience working with a large codebase shared with multi-functional teams.
Strong knowledge of SQL
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, computer engineering, electrical engineering or equivalent work experience
Preferred Qualifications
Do you have exceptional experience with, skills for, or just interest in any of the following software engineering areas?
We are looking for someone who has a good mix of the following traits:
Experiment frameworks and data driven approach to development
Authentication: SSO integration, flow optimization, security and more
SEO: Top of the funnel optimization, Log analysis, Crawl Optimization and more
Instacart's technology is constantly evolving and adapting. Some of the technologies you would use in our teams at Instacart include:
Ruby on Rails framework using Sorbet for strong-typing
Client-facing flexible APIs exposed via GraphQL
Postgres and Snowflake backend relational data stores
Async durable event handling infrastructure including async RPC via AWS SNS/SQS, RabbitMQ
Caching and durable job dispatching using Memcached and Redis
Auto-scaling elastic service deployments built on AWS ECS, ALBs, and supporting cloud services
Rich monitoring and alerting infrastructure built on AWS Cloud Watch, DataDog, Sentry, OpsGenie and supporting services
Any new integrations you will research, propose, implement, and deploy!
Join us and help Instacart grow!

details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

Checkr is looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead the International Screenings team. The team is responsible for building and delivering new background screening products and services required for the global expansion of Checkr products. The team is positioned within the International portfolio, which encompasses many products, including International Criminal, Education, Employment, and Drivers License Verification.

You will help define Checkr’s ambitious international growth strategy and product roadmap in this role, including building local capabilities, enhancing automation in critical geographies, and building new screenings. You will align internal business partners and leadership around this plan and partner with cross-functional teams to execute this plan. Success in this role requires you to enable and guide engineers to a successful launch via incremental value-adding features that make up the MVP, clear communication and expectation setting with stakeholders, and close collaboration with the Product Manager.

Our ideal candidate has built international products at scale. They are a fast learner with entrepreneurial mindsets and understand the technical, legal, and security requirements of building products in different markets.

Responsibilities:
Design, implement and scale our microservice architecture
Analyze qualitative and quantitative data to drive product, technical, and team improvements
Work with the team to reduce technical debt and sustainably scale our architecture
Optimize engineering processes and policies to drive velocity and quality
Partner closely with product management to build new features and enhance existing ones
Collaborate with our data vendor to prioritize technical and product enhancements
Manage the performance and career growth of individuals on the team
Mentor and develop the careers of team members varying in seniority and experience

What you bring:
2+ years as an engineering manager
7+ years as an engineer
Experience working on products at scale, and understanding the data, legal, human impact, and technical nuances of supporting highly regulated products
Deep understanding of software engineering principles, including service architecture and system design
Strong skills in critical thinking, decision making, problem-solving, and attention to detail
Experience with hiring and growing inclusive teams to foster growth and diversity
Ability to make high-level prioritization decisions quickly and thoughtfully
Mentor the team to grow by providing stretch assignments, and opportunities relevant to their interests
Humility, openness to feedback, and eagerness to learn

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to 25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $177,013-$208,250 and within the city limits of NYC is $208,250-$245,000.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr

Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr’s commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

full_text: Sr. Android Engineer, Connected Stores, Instacart, United States, Remote, Hide job, 1 connection works here, 1 week ago
details:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

ABOUT THE ROLE

At Instacart, we are working to delight our customers and empower our shoppers. As an Android Engineer at Instacart you will work with our teams to build robust, well-architected native applications that simplify the complex challenge of getting our customer’s orders from the store to their door. In this role you will work on challenging scaling problems while also crafting the features that will define our industry. You will build in an open collaborative environment serving millions of requests daily.

About The Team .

Our team is investing heavily in building a world-class Android app. At our velocity and volume-level we need the ability to deploy new products and features faster and better. We love, contribute and use the latest and greatest open source technology. Kotlin, RxJava, (now) Coroutines, Dagger, we use it all. We created our design system (now integrated with Jetpack Compose 🚀) to accelerate our development cycles. We have been featured during Google I/O for being leaders in Kotlin adoption. Our open source contributions have been recommended in official Google documentation, and widely adopted by the community. We are active in the AndroidDev community, with employees who are part of the GDE program. Join our team and work on building some of the best Android apps in the world.

About The Job
You will be part of a small team, with a large amount of ownership and autonomy for managing things directly
You will work closely with Product Managers, other teams, and internal and external stakeholders, owning a large part of the process from problem understanding to shipping the solution
You will ship high quality, scalable and robust solutions with a sense of urgency
You will have the freedom to suggest and drive organization-wide initiatives
You will have the freedom to explore solutions using the latest Android trends
You will educate colleagues about subtleties & unique capabilities of the platform and leveraging them when building new features
Our tech stack: We develop our native Android apps using Kotlin with RxJava and MVU (model, view, update) unidirectional state flow architecture. Our APIs on the backend are powered by GraphQL, gRPC and REST.
About You

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
3+ years of Android app development experience
Strong development skills in Kotlin and with Android SDK
Strong sense of product ownership
Automated testing experience
An ability to balance a sense of urgency with shipping high quality and pragmatic solutions
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field
Experience with RxJava
Solid understanding of various architecture patterns such as MVVM, MVP, MVI
Strong general programming and algorithm skills
Data driven mindset
Instacart provides highly market-competitive compensation and benefits in each location where our employees work. This role is remote and the base pay range for a successful candidate is dependent on their permanent work location. Please review our Flex First remote work policy here.

Offers may vary based on many factors, such as candidate experience and skills required for the role. Additionally, this role is eligible for a new hire equity grant as well as annual refresh grants. Please read more about our benefits offerings here.

For US based candidates, the base pay ranges for a successful candidate are listed below.

CA, NY, CT, NJ

$184,500—$230,000 USD

WA

$176,400—$220,000 USD

OR, DE, ME, MA, MD, NH, RI, VT, DC, PA, VA, CO, TX, IL, HI

$169,200—$210,998 USD

All other states

$153,900—$192,000 USD

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

full_text: Senior Analytics Engineer, Instacart, United States, Remote, Hide job, 1 connection works here, 2 weeks ago
details:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

Instacart is looking to hire a Senior Analytics Engineer to join our team to bridge the gap between business problems (and questions) and the technology required to answer them. You will sit between our Data Engineering and Data Science teams to enable the organization to make data-driven decisions. You will build high quality, robust data models to be used across the company by both technical and non-technical stakeholders. We’re looking for a self-driven, strategic thinker with strong product and technical skills to build on Instacart’s Data Foundations.

About The Job
Design, create and maintain analytics friendly datasets, broadly and easily consumable by technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Take part in cross functional scoping / design meetings and collaborate on infrastructure projects
Apply software engineering best practices to analytics processes. (ex. DBT, Airflow)
Establish best practices for data warehousing and pipelining
Coach Data Scientists, Analysts, Software Engineers on data modelling best practices
Work with Engineering and Data Science teams on pilot projects and “0 to 1” initiatives
Serve as Data Model/Sources subject matter expert for your given org/domain
Play the role of both Librarian and Editor of data in your domain
About You
5+ Years experience working in an analytical or software role.
Ability to translate business needs into analytical frameworks
Ability to write complex, efficient and eloquent SQL queries.
Ability to write well structured and efficient Python code
Passion for the organization and use of data to drive strategic product decisions
A desire to build and improve consumer software products
Experience working with technical and non-technical stakeholders. Able to translate technical concepts to those with a variety of technical backgrounds.
Eagerness to learn, flexibility to pivot when needed, savviness to navigate and thrive in a dynamic environment, and a growth mindset needed to build a successful team and company
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Airflow, DBT and Jinja
Experience working with or as a Data Scientist or Analyst in eCommerce
Experience with Snowflake (Querying and ELT optimizations)
Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

Evangelize Checkr’s APIs and be an advocate for Checkr in the developer community

Strong collaboration, communication and project management skills

full_text: Senior Android Engineer, Design Systems, Instacart, United States, Remote, Hide job, 1 company alumnus works here, 1 week ago
details:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

About The Role

OVERVIEW

Are you ready to take your development skills to the next level? We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our growing Instacart Design System team. You’ll be a key player in the evolution of our product suite and help build a world-class design system that supports all our business pillars. You will help evolve and scale our design system efforts in partnership with Engineers, Product Designers, Product Managers and other cross-functional partners.

The Instacart Design System team is building the next generation of our world-class design system–IDS Pantry–so you will be part of the growing team that’s bringing to life the future vision of our design language, influencing the evolution of Instacart app, Shopper app, Instacart Platform and all of Instacart’s whitelabel mobile apps and sites.

Our products are used by millions of people every year. To meet–and exceed–expectations we are rapidly improving and modernizing our front-end code base, helping raise the quality bar for our products across the entire organization. Sound exciting? Keep reading.

About The Team

The IDS team is a highly collaborative multidisciplinary team with senior specialists from Product Design, Motion Design, Accessibility, Program Management and Engineering–we’re looking to expand our Engineering team!

You will be also partnering with Senior and Staff level engineers to continue scaling our design system efforts by balancing the needs of all sides of our multi-sided marketplace ecosystem.

About The Job

We believe that a design system should emerge from the needs of our teams and are looking for a strong software engineer excited to put their users first. You will be part of a team of ~12 professionals with extensive ownership and the ability to help set best practices and contribute to improvements.

As a craft leader, you'll be responsible for contributing to the vision, strategy, and development of IDS Pantry–Instacart’s new Design System. You will advocate for our visual design, motion design, accessibility and scalability standards to ensure consistency in how we build components and experiences. You will identify design patterns across web and mobile platforms with an understanding of how to implement those into the system in a scalable way.

You will also be proactive in spearheading new initiatives, coding and documenting components, building design system tooling to improve workflows and overseeing UI component design while providing timely feedback in reviews to improve system guidelines. You will think and plan strategically for short and long-term initiatives to continue shaping the product.

Minimum Qualifications

ABOUT YOU
5+ years of Android development experience creating delightful and engaging products. Furthermore, strong understanding and knowledge of Android frameworks and build systems such as Kotlin, Jetpack Compose, Gradle, JUnit, etc.
1+ years of experience building frameworks in Android for teams that have features heavily depending on your framework
Ability building and maintaining a robust design system with a high level of design craft
You can design for scale with the entire system in mind
Strong understanding and proven experience driving WCAG accessibility standards through design system components and guidance
Understanding of complex transitions, micro-interactions, and in-product animations and experience with vector animations
Solid communicator, comfortable seeking and receiving feedback
Strong analytical and debugging skills
Strong sense of ownership working with a large codebase on a multifunctional team while maintaining high engineering standards and bringing consistency to our codebase
A collaborative mindset to be able to partner with engineers, designers and PM's from multiple teams to co-create impactful solutions while supporting system contributions
Strong organizational skills with the ability to communicate and present ideas clearly and influence key stakeholders at the manager, director, and VP level
Preferred Qualifications
Strong understanding of UI performance and latency optimization
Strong general programming and algorithm skills
Strong appreciation for aesthetic, attention to detail and accuracy in the implementation.
Experience developing digital products or using existing design tools (Figma, Sketch, XD, etc)
Experience translating prototyped Figma designs into production-ready system-level components
Data driven mindset
Instacart provides highly market-competitive compensation and benefits in each location where our employees work. This role is remote and the base pay range for a successful candidate is dependent on their permanent work location. Please review our Flex First remote work policy here.

Offers may vary based on many factors, such as candidate experience and skills required for the role. Additionally, this role is eligible for a new hire equity grant as well as annual refresh grants. Please read more about our benefits offerings here.

full_text: Senior/Staff Product Security Engineer, Instacart, United States, Remote, Hide job, 1 company alumnus works here, 2 weeks ago
details:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

We're looking for experienced Engineers to join our fast moving team. We work on a range of interesting and challenging problems, from supporting thousands of concurrent shoppers and processing millions of data points in real time, to determining the best route for deliveries and predicting store inventory levels.

At Instacart, we hold ourselves greatly responsible for protecting our customers', shoppers', partners' data and provide a secure platform to shop. As one of the early members of the security team, you will have a tremendous impact on Instacart's security posture and engineering culture. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to have a large sense of ownership, grow extraordinarily in their career, develop cross-functional technical and soft skills, in not just security, but engineering overall. Our platform is complex, rapidly scaling and processing millions of transactions in real-time, all of the time.

About The Job
Build, deploy and maintain tools to help with security intrusion detection, audit, and response.
Investigate and respond to security incidents, automating the investigation and/or remediation where possible
Conduct application design and code reviews on an ongoing basis
Help identify risk patterns and offer proactive defense suggestions
Create, review and maintain RBAC policies across AWS, GCP and Kubernetes in line with the principles of least privilege
Work with stakeholders across the organization, provide security training and outreach to our internal development teams to achieve a consistently high security bar
About You
Experience with Python and/or Go or the desire to learn them quickly
Experience with Cloud Infrastructure Security (AWS/GCP) and SOA patterns
Solid understanding of application security concepts and best practices
Ability to understand application and system architectures holistically
Dexterity to identify, analyze, scope, contain and eradicate real-world threats
Experience with Secure development life-cycle (SDLC) practices including threat modelling and security testing
Desirable
Experience with GDPR, CCPA and SOC2 compliance
Experience running bug bounty programs and triaging/resolving security vulnerabilities in the application layer.
Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.
