full_text: Senior Frontend Engineer, Design Systems, Instacart, United States, Remote, Hide job, 1 connection works here, 1 week ago
details:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

About The Role

OVERVIEW

Are you ready to take your development skills to the next level? We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our growing Instacart Design System team. You’ll be a key player in the evolution of our product suite and help build a world-class design system that supports all our business pillars. You will help evolve and scale our design system efforts in partnership with Engineers, Product Designers, Product Managers and other cross-functional partners.

The Instacart Design System team is building the next generation of our world-class design system–IDS Pantry–so you will be part of the growing team that’s bringing to life the future vision of our design language, influencing the evolution of Instacart app, Shopper app, Instacart Platform and all of Instacart’s white label mobile apps and sites.

Our products are used by millions of people every year. To meet–and exceed–expectations we are rapidly improving and modernizing our front-end code base, helping raise the quality bar for our products across the entire organization. Sound exciting? Keep reading.

About The Team

The IDS team is a highly collaborative multidisciplinary team with senior specialists from Product Design, Motion Design, Accessibility, Program Management and Engineering–we’re looking to expand our Engineering team!

You will be also partnering with Senior and Staff level engineers to continue scaling our design system efforts by balancing the needs of all sides of our multi-sided marketplace ecosystem.

About The Job

We believe that a design system should emerge from the needs of our teams and are looking for a strong software engineer excited to put their users first. You will be part of a team of ~12 professionals with extensive ownership and the ability to help set best practices and contribute to improvements.

As a craft leader, you'll be responsible for contributing to the vision, strategy, and development of IDS Pantry–Instacart’s new Design System. You will advocate for our visual design, motion design, accessibility and scalability standards to ensure consistency in how we build components and experiences. You will identify design patterns across web and mobile platforms with an understanding of how to implement those into the system in a scalable way.

You will also be proactive in spearheading new initiatives, coding and documenting components, building design system tooling to improve workflows and overseeing UI component design while providing timely feedback in reviews to improve system guidelines. You will think and plan strategically for short and long-term initiatives to continue shaping the product.

Minimum Qualifications

ABOUT YOU
5+ years of modern Javascript experience creating delightful and engaging products. Furthermore, strong understanding and knowledge of React, TypeScript, CSS (optionally CSS-in-JS), Semantic HTML, Unit Testing (Jest or similar), Semantic Versioning, and JS Package Management
1+ years of experience building frameworks in Android, iOS or React for teams that have features heavily depending on your framework
Ability building and maintaining a robust design system with a high level of design craft
You can design for scale with the entire system in mind
Strong understanding and proven experience driving WCAG accessibility standards through design system components and guidance
Understanding of complex transitions, micro-interactions, and in-product animations and experience with vector animations
Solid communicator, comfortable seeking and receiving feedback
Strong analytical and debugging skills
Strong sense of ownership working with a large codebase on a multifunctional team while maintaining high engineering standards and bringing consistency to our codebase
A collaborative mindset to be able to partner with engineers, designers and PM's from multiple teams to co-create impactful solutions while supporting system contributions
Strong organizational skills with the ability to communicate and present ideas clearly and influence key stakeholders at the manager, director, and VP level
Preferred Qualifications
Knowledge of modern front-end build systems and languages
Strong understanding of UI performance and latency optimization
Strong general programming and algorithm skills
Strong appreciation for aesthetic, attention to detail and accuracy in the implementation
Experience developing digital products or using existing design tools (Figma, Sketch, XD, etc)
Experience translating prototyped Figma designs into production-ready system-level components
Data driven mindset
Instacart provides highly market-competitive compensation and benefits in each location where our employees work. This role is remote and the base pay range for a successful candidate is dependent on their permanent work location. Please review our Flex First remote work policy here.

Offers may vary based on many factors, such as candidate experience and skills required for the role. Additionally, this role is eligible for a new hire equity grant as well as annual refresh grants. Please read more about our benefits offerings here.

For US based candidates, the base pay ranges for a successful candidate are listed below.

CA, NY, CT, NJ

$184,500—$205,000 USD

WA

$176,400—$196,000 USD

OR, DE, ME, MA, MD, NH, RI, VT, DC, PA, VA, CO, TX, IL, HI

$169,200—$188,000 USD

All other states

$153,900—$171,000 USD

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

full_text: Senior Software Engineer, Trust & Safety (T&S), Checkr, Inc., New Jersey, United States, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 1 alum works here, Promoted, 0 applicants
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

This position is for our Tessera Data business, which is focused on building a safer future, online and offline, by providing valuable people data to drive informed trust and safety decisions. Our industry-leading data serves as the backbone for background checks used to protect a company’s employees, customers, and community. We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join their team that is highly collaborative and cares deeply about the mission of our company, is eager to work with a diverse team of engineers and has a quality-focused mindset. In this role, the Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for integration of the recently acquired background checks solution into Tessera in the near future, working on the data vendor integrations and evolving it into the identity verification platform long-term. The background check solution currently contains several public APIs, public and internal portals, and a handful of microservices. To be successful, this individual will work on integrating the acquired background check product into the Tessera ecosystem and will work on turning it into a solid foundation to build a complex identity verification solution.

We are a team of data explorers that thrive in acquiring, processing, and delivering data to solve trust and safety decisions! Join our team and be part of:
The industry leader in public records data aggregation and data classification/normalization
A collaborative environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally
An environment where your voice matters: Be vocal, we want to hear your ideas
A fun, creative, cooperative, and multicultural team

Responsibilities:
Own the product development from ideation, design, implementation, to release
Partner with the technical lead in designing and architecting new systems
Collaborate with the technical lead and remote team in implementation
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
Deliver performant, reliable, scalable, and secure code

What you bring:
5+ years experience as a software engineer working with .NET
Experience designing and implementing REST APIs
Experience building lambda based applications on AWS
Experience building CI/CD using Serverless, Cloudformation, Terraform or similar
Experience building asynchronous processing pipelines using message queuing systems such as AWS SQS/SNS, RabbitMQ, Kafka or similar
Experience working with both RDBMS and NoSQL data stores such as SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB
A strong understanding of microservice architecture infrastructure, inclusive of familiarity with Kubernetes
A passion for optimizing services for scale and speed
A great desire to learn, collaborate, improve, and innovate

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to $25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to 25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $122,103-$143,650 and within the city limits of NYC is $143,650 - $169,000.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Tessera

Tessera is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Tessera believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Tessera also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Tessera's commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

We're looking for outstanding operations research (OR) scientists to join our fast moving team. We work on a range of interesting and challenging problems, from making sure orders are fulfilled efficiently and on-time to helping customers decide what to buy. Machine learning and Operations Research are at the heart of this effort and an essential ingredient in Instacart's aggressive growth plan and vision for the future.

We love operations research scientists who are motivated not only by researching new solutions, but by owning the problem and implementation end to end. There is tremendous opportunity in front of us, and joining now gives you a chance to grow your career and interests as we succeed.

About The Job
You will work on real-time fulfillment systems and build/code scalable solutions to continuously evolving and incredibly challenging logistics problems.
You will be dedicated to a small cross-discipline product team, with tremendous ownership and responsibility for managing things directly.
You will be an active member of an internal community of operations research scientists and machine learning engineers sharing learnings, best practices and research across many domains.
You will ship high quality solutions with a sense of urgency and speed.
You will work closely with engineers, product managers, other teams, and both internal and external stakeholders, owning a large part of the process from problem understanding to shipping the solution.
You will have the freedom to suggest and drive organization-wide initiatives.
You will mentor others on best practices for design and implementation of cutting-edge OR solutions.
About You
Bachelor's degree (M.S./PhD preferred) in Operations Research, Applied Mathematics or a related field
4+ years of industry experience using operations research to solve real-world problems
Expertise in mathematical optimization, and implementing scalable tailored solution approaches and heuristics to solve optimization problems
Experience building real-time optimization engines and predictive modeling. Direct experience working on balancing supply and demand in a complex marketplace is a big plus.
3+ years experience in building models and developing scalable algorithms for machine learning, mathematical programming and simulation
2+ years experience with developing heuristic methods, problem decomposition and optimization using PuLP, Gurobi, CPLEX or related tools
2+ years experience in handling data and writing production applications using Python (pandas, numpy etc), R, SQL
A blend of operations research, data mining, predictive modeling, statistical analysis and people knowledge that lets you jump into a fast paced environment and contribute from day one
Instacart provides highly market-competitive compensation and benefits in each location where our employees work. This role is remote and the base pay range for a successful candidate is dependent on their permanent work location. Please review our Flex First remote work policy here.

Offers may vary based on many factors, such as candidate experience and skills required for the role. Additionally, this role is eligible for a new hire equity grant as well as annual refresh grants. Please read more about our benefits offerings here.

For US based candidates, the base pay ranges for a successful candidate are listed below.

CA, NY, CT, NJ

$174,600—$221,000 USD

WA

$166,500—$212,000 USD

OR, DE, ME, MA, MD, NH, RI, VT, DC, PA, VA, CO, TX, IL, HI

$159,300—$203,000 USD

All other states

$144,900—$184,000 USD

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

full_text: Engineering Manager, International, Checkr, Inc., Irvine, CA, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 1 alum works here, Promoted, 8 applicants
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

Checkr is looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead the International Screenings team. The team is responsible for building and delivering new background screening products and services required for the global expansion of Checkr products. The team is positioned within the International portfolio, which encompasses many products, including International Criminal, Education, Employment, and Drivers License Verification.

You will help define Checkr’s ambitious international growth strategy and product roadmap in this role, including building local capabilities, enhancing automation in critical geographies, and building new screenings. You will align internal business partners and leadership around this plan and partner with cross-functional teams to execute this plan. Success in this role requires you to enable and guide engineers to a successful launch via incremental value-adding features that make up the MVP, clear communication and expectation setting with stakeholders, and close collaboration with the Product Manager.

Our ideal candidate has built international products at scale. They are a fast learner with entrepreneurial mindsets and understand the technical, legal, and security requirements of building products in different markets.

Responsibilities:
Design, implement and scale our microservice architecture
Analyze qualitative and quantitative data to drive product, technical, and team improvements
Work with the team to reduce technical debt and sustainably scale our architecture
Optimize engineering processes and policies to drive velocity and quality
Partner closely with product management to build new features and enhance existing ones
Collaborate with our data vendor to prioritize technical and product enhancements
Manage the performance and career growth of individuals on the team
Mentor and develop the careers of team members varying in seniority and experience

What you bring:
2+ years as an engineering manager
7+ years as an engineer
Experience working on products at scale, and understanding the data, legal, human impact, and technical nuances of supporting highly regulated products
Deep understanding of software engineering principles, including service architecture and system design
Strong skills in critical thinking, decision making, problem-solving, and attention to detail
Experience with hiring and growing inclusive teams to foster growth and diversity
Ability to make high-level prioritization decisions quickly and thoughtfully
Mentor the team to grow by providing stretch assignments, and opportunities relevant to their interests
Humility, openness to feedback, and eagerness to learn

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to 25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $177,013-$208,250 and within the city limits of NYC is $208,250-$245,000.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr

Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr’s commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

This position is for our Tessera Data business, which is focused on building a safer future, online and offline, by providing valuable people data to drive informed trust and safety decisions. Our industry-leading data serves as the backbone for background checks used to protect a company’s employees, customers, and community. We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join their team that is highly collaborative and cares deeply about the mission of our company, is eager to work with a diverse team of engineers and has a quality-focused mindset. In this role, the Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for integration of the recently acquired background checks solution into Tessera in the near future, working on the data vendor integrations and evolving it into the identity verification platform long-term. The background check solution currently contains several public APIs, public and internal portals, and a handful of microservices. To be successful, this individual will work on integrating the acquired background check product into the Tessera ecosystem and will work on turning it into a solid foundation to build a complex identity verification solution.

We are a team of data explorers that thrive in acquiring, processing, and delivering data to solve trust and safety decisions! Join our team and be part of:
The industry leader in public records data aggregation and data classification/normalization
A collaborative environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally
An environment where your voice matters: Be vocal, we want to hear your ideas
A fun, creative, cooperative, and multicultural team

Own the product development from ideation, design, implementation, to release
Partner with the technical lead in designing and architecting new systems
Collaborate with the technical lead and remote team in implementation
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
Deliver performant, reliable, scalable, and secure code

5+ years experience as a software engineer working with .NET
Experience designing and implementing REST APIs
Experience building lambda based applications on AWS
Experience building CI/CD using Serverless, Cloudformation, Terraform or similar
Experience building asynchronous processing pipelines using message queuing systems such as AWS SQS/SNS, RabbitMQ, Kafka or similar
Experience working with both RDBMS and NoSQL data stores such as SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB
A strong understanding of microservice architecture infrastructure, inclusive of familiarity with Kubernetes
A passion for optimizing services for scale and speed
A great desire to learn, collaborate, improve, and innovate

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment

Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to $25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

full_text: Senior Data Scientist, Customer Analytics, Spring Health, United States, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, 401(k), Hide job, 4 alumni work here, 1 week ago
details:
Our mission: eliminating every barrier to mental health.

Spring Health is a comprehensive mental health solution for employers and health plans. Unlike any other solution, we use clinically validated technology called Precision Mental Healthcare to pinpoint and deliver exactly what will work for each person — whether that’s meditation, coaching, therapy, medication, and beyond.

Today, Spring Health equips over 800 companies, from start-ups to multinational Fortune 500 corporations, as a leading and preferred mental health service. Companies like General Mills, Guardian, Bain, and Instacart use the Spring Health platform to provide mental health services to thousands of their team members globally. We have raised over $300 million from prominent investors including Kinnevik, Tiger Global, Northzone, RRE Ventures, Rethink Impact, Work-Bench, William K Warren Foundation, SemperVirens, Able Partners, True Capital Ventures, and a strategic investor, Guardian Life Insurance. Thanks to their partnership, our current valuation has reached $2 billion.

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Customer Analytics team. This is a new team building data products that enable our customers to understand the impact Spring Health is creating for their organization. In this role you will work closely with our customers and our internal teams to discover and scale the data narratives that highlight how we are eliminating barriers to mental health.

What You’ll Be Doing

Be part of a team of innovative data scientists building the analytics story that demonstrates Spring Health's value to customers
Rapidly iterate with customers and our internal Sales and Customer Success teams to materialize that story in a scalable data product
Analyze data across all aspects of the member mental health journey to show our customers the value of their investment and provide them with actionable insights on how to further improve member wellbeing

What We Expect From You

You are passionate about changing the face of mental health care and Spring Health’s mission to remove all barriers to mental health resonates with you
You have a degree in a STEM-related field and at least 5 years of commercial experience in a data science role
You have exceptional communication skills, and have operated in a role that required frequent interaction with customers
You are proficient in SQL and Python
You have deep expertise building data transformation pipelines with DBT
You have experience building dashboards in Looker and training non-technical stakeholders on how to use them
Proven ability to proactively manage your own priorities and dependencies in alignment with cross-functional dependencies and product/business impact
Passion for successfully navigating ambiguous problem areas and learning new approaches
You are energized by mentoring others and enjoy defining processes that help to scale your team
Bonus points for previous experience in benefits consulting, people analytics, or marketing

The target salary range for this position is $159,100 - $175,050 and is part of a competitive total rewards package including stock options, benefits, and incentive pay for eligible roles. Individual pay may vary from the target range and is determined by a number of factors including experience, location, internal pay equity, and other relevant business considerations. We review all employee pay and compensation programs annually at minimum to ensure competitive and fair pay.

Hypergrowth meets impact

What To Expect Working Here

You will be held accountable to an exceptionally high bar and impact.
This may be the fastest work environment you will ever experience in terms of growth, decision-making, and time to impact.
You will be challenged to set and protect your own boundaries.
You will create processes & products that have never existed before.
You will have very direct conversations and receive continuous feedback to push you to become the highest performer you can be.
Change is a constant here: your role, team, responsibilities, and success metrics will shift as the company grows.

And...

You get to be surrounded by some of the brightest minds in the field.
You get to learn and grow at an extremely accelerated pace.
You will experience transparency, integrity, & humility from leadership.
You will be empowered to constantly challenge the status quo.
You get the space to experimentation & innovation.
You get to make a transformational impact for the company, mental health, and for real human lives — and you will see that impact quickly.
You will become more resourceful and resilient.
You get to be part of a winning team that opens doors in the future.

Ready to do the most impactful work of your life? Learn more about our values, how we work, and how hypergrowth meets impact at Spring Health: Our Values

Our privacy policy: https://springhealth.com/privacy-policy/

Don’t meet every requirement? Studies have shown that women, communities of color and historically underrepresented talent are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Spring Health we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we strongly encourage you to apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles!

Benefits Provided By Spring Health

Focus on total health including:

Generous medical, dental, vision coverage available day 1 + access to One Medical.
12 yearly no-cost visits to the Spring Health network of therapists and medication management providers for you and your dependents.
Unlimited paid time off, 12 paid holidays throughout the year, and 10 sick days
4-4.5 months of fully paid parental leave.
$500 per year Wellness Reimbursement.
Supporting you financially through:
Our People team benchmarks all salaries using the Radford Global Compensation Database for technology and life sciences industries. Radford benchmarks salaries with 3,589 global firms, 6.5 million employees, and 98 countries across the globe. We do this to ensure all of our team members are paid equally and competitively.
On top of competitive and benchmarked salary, Spring Health offers incentive pay (based on role), and equity that begins vesting after one year with the company.
Employer sponsored 401(k) match of up to 2% after 90 days of employment.

Creating a Culture You Can Thrive In
Flexible work arrangements:
60% of Spring Health team members work fully remote while 40% work in a hybrid model from our New York City offices.
Calm Fridays: no meetings, no distractions, just time for you to get work done.
$200 per year donation matching to support your favorite causes.
Our team members have created five employee resource groups thus far and looking to add on more

Ready to do the most impactful work of your life? Learn more about what motivates us and the ways we work to see if this is the right place for you: Our Values

Spring Health is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable legal requirements. Spring Health is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Our privacy policy: https://springhealth.com/privacy-policy/

details:

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to drive analytics efforts targeted at enhancing end user experience within Spring Health’s software applications. You will be embedded in a product development team focusing on end user (Spring Health members’ or caregivers’) experiences and cover the entire feature launch cycle - from uncovering experience improvement opportunities to synthesizing actionable learnings and possible next steps post-launch. This role is highly collaborative: you will work closely with your product management, design, engineering, and user research counterparts and help the team connect the dots between product initiatives and business outcomes.

What You’ll Be Doing

You will collaborate with product development leads on defining key indicators of the quality of our member and caregiver experience and uncovering opportunities to improve these metrics
You will ideate and design A/B tests to evaluate new product features
You will define product telemetry that enables seamless reporting and analysis
You will build necessary data models and insightful, automated dashboards necessary to track key product metrics
You will actively participate in prioritization and roadmapping discussions
You will lean into appropriate advanced methods, from advanced experimentation techniques to causal inference and statistical modeling, for deep-dive analyses around user interaction patterns
You will participate in the development of data-centric product features

What We Expect From You

Passion for changing the face of mental health care and excitement about Spring Health’s mission to remove all barriers to mental health
5 years of professional experience in a data role (data analyst, product analyst, data scientist, or similar), and at least 2 years of experience working with and defining product or growth metrics
Previous exposure to experimentation or hypothesis testing
Previous exposure to product development/design or a strong desire to learn all about it
Proficiency with SQL and a statistical analysis language (R/Python)
Experience working with BI tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Metabase) and product analytics SaaS tools (e.g. Mixpanel, Amplitude, Heap, etc.)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to guide and make recommendations to technical and non-technical business users
Proven ability to proactively manage your own priorities and dependencies in alignment with cross-functional dependencies and product/business impact
Passion for successfully navigating ambiguous problem areas and learning new approaches
Proximity to NYC or willingness to travel once a quarter to NYC

Solutions Engineer

They are responsible for working with our most complex prospects to design and develop unique solutions that enhance trust and safety in the hiring process. Solutions Engineers at Checkr are experienced problem solvers with a background in Solutions Engineering, Customer Success, Technical Account Management, Client Consulting, and understand how technology delivers business value. You will be responsible for providing pre-sales support for our most valuable prospects and partners.

Responsibilities:

As a Solutions Engineer, you will strategically partner with the Sales Team to:
Meet with business leaders at prospect companies to understand their business goals and articulate Checkr’s value proposition
Meet with stakeholders across the organization, from C-Level executives to frontline employees and tailor your messaging to these audiences
Shape value creation for our clients through presentations, case studies, product demonstrations, pilots, solution designs, and proposals
Educate our prospective clients on safe hiring best practices, explaining how other Checkr customers have approached obstacles and challenges, and generally serving as the trust & safety experts during sales cycles
Answer technical and compliance questions from our prospects and partners
Distill and communicate customer needs to the Product team and help drive product roadmap
Collaborate with Marketing on Case Studies, Use Cases and Marketing Events

What you bring:
2-5 years in related industry or SAAS
Mastery of the technical sales process, solution design, and proof of value execution
Expertise in discovery conversations, value-based selling, and world class demonstration and storytelling skills
Technical curiosity and knowledge of RESTful APIs or willingness to learn
Experience building rapport and working with cross functional teams spanning sales, product management, product marketing and business development
Ability to juggle and complete multiple priorities and projects (both internal and external) in a fast-paced environment
Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
Willingness and Ability to travel as needed (30% or higher)

What you get:
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental and vision coverage
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $101,150.40 - $119,000 and within the city limits of NYC is $119,000-$140,000. This position is also eligible to participate in Checkr’s commission plan/bonus plan

Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr

Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr’s commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

full_text: Data Scientist, Customer Analytics, Spring Health, United States, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, 401(k), Hide job, 4 alumni work here, 2 weeks ago
details:
Our mission: eliminating every barrier to mental health.

Spring Health is a comprehensive mental health solution for employers and health plans. Unlike any other solution, we use clinically validated technology called Precision Mental Healthcare to pinpoint and deliver exactly what will work for each person — whether that’s meditation, coaching, therapy, medication, and beyond.

Today, Spring Health equips over 800 companies, from start-ups to multinational Fortune 500 corporations, as a leading and preferred mental health service. Companies like General Mills, Guardian, Bain, and Instacart use the Spring Health platform to provide mental health services to thousands of their team members globally. We have raised over $300 million from prominent investors including Kinnevik, Tiger Global, Northzone, RRE Ventures, Rethink Impact, Work-Bench, William K Warren Foundation, SemperVirens, Able Partners, True Capital Ventures, and a strategic investor, Guardian Life Insurance. Thanks to their partnership, our current valuation has reached $2 billion.

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Customer Analytics team. This team drives the analytics and data products that enable our customers to understand the impact Spring Health is creating for their organization.

What You’ll Be Doing

Be part of a team of innovative data scientists building the analytics story that demonstrates Spring Health's value to customers
Rapidly iterate with customers and our internal Sales and Customer Success teams to materialize that story in a scalable data product
Develop a deep understanding of how organizations design and evaluate their employee benefit programs
Analyze data across all aspects of the member mental health journey to show our customers their return on investment and provide them with actionable insights on how to further improve member wellbeing

What We Expect From You

You are passionate about changing the face of mental health care and Spring Health’s mission to remove all barriers to mental health resonates with you
You have a degree in a STEM-related field and at least 2-3 years of commercial experience in a data science role
You are a proficient in SQL and Python
You have experience working with Looker, both creating up the data model and building dashboards
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to guide and make recommendations to technical and non-technical business users
Proven ability to proactively manage your own priorities and dependencies in alignment with cross-functional dependencies and product/business impact
You enjoy telling stories with data - you’re excited about finding the narrative that will resonate most deeply with your audience
You are humble, highly motivated, and thrive in fast-paced environments
Passion for successfully navigating ambiguous problem areas and learning new approaches

What We'd Love To See (Bonus)

You have experience using any of the following data: EMR, clinical trials, claims data
You have taken a data product from zero to one
You have experience with data modeling for reporting and analysis using tools such as dbt or similar
You have operated in a role that required interaction with customers

The target salary range for this position is $120,000 - $146,750 [hiring range max], and is part of a competitive total rewards package including stock options, benefits, and incentive pay for eligible roles. Individual pay may vary from the target range and is determined by a number of factors including experience, location, internal pay equity, and other relevant business considerations. We review all employee pay and compensation programs annually at minimum to ensure competitive and fair pay.

Hypergrowth meets impact

What To Expect Working Here

You will be held accountable to an exceptionally high bar and impact.
This may be the fastest work environment you will ever experience in terms of growth, decision-making, and time to impact.
You will be challenged to set and protect your own boundaries.
You will create processes & products that have never existed before.
You will have very direct conversations and receive continuous feedback to push you to become the highest performer you can be.
Change is a constant here: your role, team, responsibilities, and success metrics will shift as the company grows.

And...

You get to be surrounded by some of the brightest minds in the field.
You get to learn and grow at an extremely accelerated pace.
You will experience transparency, integrity, & humility from leadership.
You will be empowered to constantly challenge the status quo.
You get the space to experimentation & innovation.
You get to make a transformational impact for the company, mental health, and for real human lives — and you will see that impact quickly.
You will become more resourceful and resilient.
You get to be part of a winning team that opens doors in the future.

Ready to do the most impactful work of your life? Learn more about our values, how we work, and how hypergrowth meets impact at Spring Health: Our Values

Our privacy policy: https://springhealth.com/privacy-policy/

Don’t meet every requirement? Studies have shown that women, communities of color and historically underrepresented talent are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Spring Health we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we strongly encourage you to apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles!

Benefits Provided By Spring Health

Focus on total health including:

Generous medical, dental, vision coverage available day 1 + access to One Medical.
12 yearly no-cost visits to the Spring Health network of therapists and medication management providers for you and your dependents.
Unlimited paid time off, 12 paid holidays throughout the year, and 10 sick days
4-4.5 months of fully paid parental leave.
$500 per year Wellness Reimbursement.
Supporting you financially through:
Our People team benchmarks all salaries using the Radford Global Compensation Database for technology and life sciences industries. Radford benchmarks salaries with 3,589 global firms, 6.5 million employees, and 98 countries across the globe. We do this to ensure all of our team members are paid equally and competitively.
On top of competitive and benchmarked salary, Spring Health offers incentive pay (based on role), and equity that begins vesting after one year with the company.
Employer sponsored 401(k) match of up to 2% after 90 days of employment.

Creating a Culture You Can Thrive In
Flexible work arrangements:
60% of Spring Health team members work fully remote while 40% work in a hybrid model from our New York City offices.
Calm Fridays: no meetings, no distractions, just time for you to get work done.
$200 per year donation matching to support your favorite causes.
Our team members have created five employee resource groups thus far and looking to add on more

Ready to do the most impactful work of your life? Learn more about what motivates us and the ways we work to see if this is the right place for you: Our Values

Spring Health is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable legal requirements. Spring Health is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Our privacy policy: https://springhealth.com/privacy-policy/

details:

Develop predictive models for both business and clinical applications, helping the teams understand how decisions we make now may impact the future
Lead the dissemination of those models’ output to a range of stakeholders, both technical and non-technical, ensuring teams understand how to use the predictions to effectively make decisions for our business
Contribute to the technical tooling we develop to support predictive modeling more broadly
Shape the team’s set of best practices and guidelines for defining, building, testing, and deploying models

You are an expert with time series modeling, and have built and tested models using common techniques (MA, AR, ARIMA, etc) using either R or Python
You have strong SQL skills and are comfortable digging into a data model to get the data you need
You have exceptional communication skills, and are comfortable working independently with executive level team members
You focus on impact, finding the things you can deliver that deliver the most value for your stakeholders

full_text: Senior Software Engineer, Trust & Safety (T&S), Checkr, Inc., Atlanta, GA, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 1 alum works here, Promoted, 0 applicants
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

This position is for our Tessera Data business, which is focused on building a safer future, online and offline, by providing valuable people data to drive informed trust and safety decisions. Our industry-leading data serves as the backbone for background checks used to protect a company’s employees, customers, and community. We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join their team that is highly collaborative and cares deeply about the mission of our company, is eager to work with a diverse team of engineers and has a quality-focused mindset. In this role, the Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for integration of the recently acquired background checks solution into Tessera in the near future, working on the data vendor integrations and evolving it into the identity verification platform long-term. The background check solution currently contains several public APIs, public and internal portals, and a handful of microservices. To be successful, this individual will work on integrating the acquired background check product into the Tessera ecosystem and will work on turning it into a solid foundation to build a complex identity verification solution.

We are a team of data explorers that thrive in acquiring, processing, and delivering data to solve trust and safety decisions! Join our team and be part of:
The industry leader in public records data aggregation and data classification/normalization
A collaborative environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally
An environment where your voice matters: Be vocal, we want to hear your ideas
A fun, creative, cooperative, and multicultural team

Responsibilities:
Own the product development from ideation, design, implementation, to release
Partner with the technical lead in designing and architecting new systems
Collaborate with the technical lead and remote team in implementation
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
Deliver performant, reliable, scalable, and secure code

What you bring:
5+ years experience as a software engineer working with .NET
Experience designing and implementing REST APIs
Experience building lambda based applications on AWS
Experience building CI/CD using Serverless, Cloudformation, Terraform or similar
Experience building asynchronous processing pipelines using message queuing systems such as AWS SQS/SNS, RabbitMQ, Kafka or similar
Experience working with both RDBMS and NoSQL data stores such as SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB
A strong understanding of microservice architecture infrastructure, inclusive of familiarity with Kubernetes
A passion for optimizing services for scale and speed
A great desire to learn, collaborate, improve, and innovate

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to $25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to 25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $122,103-$143,650 and within the city limits of NYC is $143,650 - $169,000.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Tessera

Tessera is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Tessera believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Tessera also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Tessera's commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

full_text: Senior Data Scientist, Machine Learning, Moveworks, Mountain View, CA, Hide job, Your profile matches this job, 5 days ago
details:
Sr. Data Scientist, Machine Learning

In this two part blog “The future (of Employee Experience) is Converational” (Part 1 - Understanding the language barrier between people and machines, Part 2 - How machines learned the secrets of language, we discussed a vision for the future of employee experience using Conversational AI. Through the years, we have built a range of enterprise applications on the foundation of a robust conversation system powered by AI/NLP. Now we are seeking seasoned Data Scientists to help shape the future of conversational AI with data rigor.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, natural language process, online experimentation, and quantitative methods. In addition, hands-on ability to push production code with sound engineering fundamentals would be nice to have. You will collaborate closely with a vibrant cross-functional team (ML engineers, data engineers, designers and product managers).

If you are looking to apply state-of-the-art Machine Learning / Data Science techniques to novel products leveraging AI/NLP, we have the opportunity for you.

Who we are:

Moveworks is revolutionizing how companies support their employees - with the first AI platform that makes getting help at work effortless. Using advanced conversational AI built for the enterprise, Moveworks gives employees exactly what they need, from IT support to HR help to policy information. Our platform allows customers like DocuSign, Twitter, Snowflake, Instacart, Coca Cola, and Hearst to move forward on what matters.

Founded in 2016, Moveworks has raised $315 million in funding, at a valuation of $2.1 billion. We’ve been named to the Forbes AI 50 list for three consecutive years, while earning recognition as the Best Chatbot Solution at the 2021 AI Breakthrough Awards. Above all, we’ve built an AI company that puts people first, which is why Built In named Moveworks the #1 Best Place to Work in the Bay Area.

What you will do:

Develop machine learning and statistical solutions end-to-end through the full life cycle of proof-of-concept, evaluation, deployment and maintenance.
Collaborate with data and analytics engineers to build scalable data pipelines to support product areas.
Apply quantitative methods and curate relevant data sets to address challenges in different components of the chatbot system (ML and conversation systems).
Develop measurement methodologies and experimentation strategies to ensure effective data-driven decision making.
Drive projects forward by forming close collaborations with cross-functional partners to reach the end deliverables, such as production-grade models or analyses that shape the technical vision.

Who you are:

You have advanced degrees in Math/Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Computer Science, Economics, or equivalent practical experience.
You have 5+ years of experience solving real-world problems using machine learning and quantitative approaches; conversational systems experience is a plus.
You are well-versed in experimental design, metric definition, and other advanced measurement techniques.
You have expertise in programming skills (e.g. Python or R), visualization, SQL, data modeling, ETL, and the data warehousing concepts.
You are comfortable proposing engineering enhancements/changes to drive deeper insights.
You are comfortable with ambiguity and able to thrive with minimal oversight and process.
You are an effective communicator; and you empathize with customers and stakeholders to build meaningful relationships.
You are curious and bring genuine excitement to learn new subject areas and are comfortable to be scrappy as and when needed.

full_text: Machine Learning Engineer, Moveworks, Mountain View, CA, Hide job, You have a preferred skill badge, 1 week ago
details:
We are looking for a Machine Learning engineer who can join us in expanding our NLU capabilities to understand every kind of enterprise issue. You will be tuning our existing NLU models as well as building new models to adapt to different domains beyond enterprise IT, taking advantage of the latest and greatest transfer learning technologies. This work is highly impactful on our team’s core value that is to build a natural language platform to help employees with all their enterprise problems, with deep collaboration to many of the functionalities within Moveworks.

If you are looking to do the best work of your career with a bright, dedicated, and impact-driven team alongside you, we’d love to have a conversation.

Who we are:

Moveworks is revolutionizing how companies support their employees — with the first AI platform that makes getting help at work effortless. Using advanced conversational AI built for the enterprise, Moveworks gives employees exactly what they need, from IT support to HR help to policy information. Our platform allows customers like Snowflake, Slack, DocuSign, LinkedIn, Instacart, Illumina, Epic Games, Hearst Media to move forward on what matters.

Founded in 2016, Moveworks has raised $315 million in funding, at a valuation of $2.1 billion. We’ve been named to the Forbes AI 50 list for three consecutive years, while earning recognition as the Best Chatbot Solution at the 2021 AI Breakthrough Awards. Above all, we’ve built an AI company that puts people first, which is why Built In named Moveworks the #1 Best Place to Work in the Bay Area.

What Will you do?

Apply machine learning, NLP, and deep learning methods to unstructured data sets and complex systems
Use your knowledge of machine learning fundamentals to develop and execute new algorithms, evaluate with small scale experiments and later productionize solutions at scale
Investigate and solve exciting and difficult challenges in various NLU tasks, classification, data science, content analysis, knowledge graph
Research and develop innovative, scalable and dynamic solutions to hard problems
Use the latest advances in machine learning, data science, neural network, and deep learning to enhance our products and create delightful user experiences
Spend time weekly reading, discussing, and potentially building models off of the latest ML research

What do you bring to the table?

You have experience training and serving machine learning modeling.
Experience to productionize ML models in a scalable system is a plus
You have strong familiarity with frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, LightGBM
You are familiar with deep learning architectures and algorithms
You have experience with NLP frameworks like SpaCY, Gensim, or NLTK
You feel at home developing on Linux with languages like Python, c++, or GoLang
Desire to work at a startup pace in a small company with a high degree of ownership
Strong motivation, gumption, and an appetite for continuous, incremental changes and completing challenging projects fast
High level of curiosity about engineering outside of your immediate discipline and an incessant desire to learn

Solutions Engineers at Checkr are experienced problem solvers with a background in Solutions Engineering, Customer Success, Technical Account Management, Client Consulting, and understand how technology delivers business value. You will be responsible for providing pre-sales support for our most valuable prospects and partners.

Responsibilities:

As a Solutions Engineer, you will strategically partner with the Sales Team to:
Meet with business leaders at prospect companies to understand their business goals and articulate Checkr’s value proposition
Meet with stakeholders across the organization, from C-Level executives to frontline employees and tailor your messaging to these audiences
Shape value creation for our clients through presentations, case studies, product demonstrations, pilots, solution designs, and proposals
Educate our prospective clients on safe hiring best practices, explaining how other Checkr customers have approached obstacles and challenges, and generally serving as the trust & safety experts during sales cycles
Answer technical and compliance questions from our prospects and partners
Distill and communicate customer needs to the Product team and help drive product roadmap
Collaborate with Marketing on Case Studies, Use Cases and Marketing Events

What you bring:
2-5 years in related industry or SAAS
Mastery of the technical sales process, solution design, and proof of value execution
Expertise in discovery conversations, value-based selling, and world class demonstration and storytelling skills
Technical curiosity and knowledge of RESTful APIs or willingness to learn
Experience building rapport and working with cross functional teams spanning sales, product management, product marketing and business development
Ability to juggle and complete multiple priorities and projects (both internal and external) in a fast-paced environment
Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
Willingness and Ability to travel as needed (30% or higher)

What you get:
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental and vision coverage
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $101,150.40 - $119,000 and within the city limits of NYC is $119,000-$140,000. This position is also eligible to participate in Checkr’s commission plan/bonus plan

Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr

Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr’s commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

This position is for our Tessera Data business, which is focused on building a safer future, online and offline, by providing valuable people data to drive informed trust and safety decisions. Our industry-leading data serves as the backbone for background checks used to protect a company’s employees, customers, and community. We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join their team that is highly collaborative and cares deeply about the mission of our company, is eager to work with a diverse team of engineers and has a quality-focused mindset. In this role, the Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for integration of the recently acquired background checks solution into Tessera in the near future, working on the data vendor integrations and evolving it into the identity verification platform long-term. The background check solution currently contains several public APIs, public and internal portals, and a handful of microservices. To be successful, this individual will work on integrating the acquired background check product into the Tessera ecosystem and will work on turning it into a solid foundation to build a complex identity verification solution.

We are a team of data explorers that thrive in acquiring, processing, and delivering data to solve trust and safety decisions! Join our team and be part of:
The industry leader in public records data aggregation and data classification/normalization
A collaborative environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally
An environment where your voice matters: Be vocal, we want to hear your ideas
A fun, creative, cooperative, and multicultural team

Own the product development from ideation, design, implementation, to release
Partner with the technical lead in designing and architecting new systems
Collaborate with the technical lead and remote team in implementation
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
Deliver performant, reliable, scalable, and secure code

Experience designing and implementing REST APIs
Experience building lambda based applications on AWS

Experience building asynchronous processing pipelines using message queuing systems such as AWS SQS/SNS, RabbitMQ, Kafka or similar

A strong understanding of microservice architecture infrastructure, inclusive of familiarity with Kubernetes
A passion for optimizing services for scale and speed
A great desire to learn, collaborate, improve, and innovate

full_text: Sr. Software Engineer, Conversation Product, Moveworks, Mountain View, CA, Hide job, You have a preferred skill badge, 1 day ago, 22 applicants
details:
As part of the Conversation Engine team, you have the opportunity to work on the very heart of the groundbreaking Conversational AI product that Moveworks is building for enterprise users. Check out our recent blog postings (part1, part2) here. You will be responsible for building out the user-facing conversation flows and skills which constitute the bridge between the latest Conversational AI framework and the customer impact!

As the pioneer for enterprise AI products, we do not have an established formula for building out the next solution - instead, you will apply your innovation and imagination on unsolved problems.

We don’t require prior experience in conversational AI products. Instead, we look for top performance in your past jobs, passion for optimizing end user facing product features, and a clear thinking framework for building a scalable and tailored user experience. You will be working closely with Machine Learning experts and cross-functional teams for the design and implementation of critical product features.This is an opportunity to play an integral role at the fastest-growing AI startup in its space.

Who we are:

Moveworks is revolutionizing how companies support their employees — with the first AI platform that makes getting help at work effortless. Using advanced conversational AI built for the enterprise, Moveworks gives employees exactly what they need, from IT support to HR help to policy information. Our platform allows customers like DocuSign, Twitter, Snowflake, Instacart, Coca Cola, and Hearst to move forward on what matters.

Founded in 2016, Moveworks has raised $315 million in funding, at a valuation of $2.1 billion. We’ve been named to the Forbes AI 50 list for three consecutive years, while earning recognition as the Best Chatbot Solution at the 2021 AI Breakthrough Awards. Above all, we’ve built an AI company that puts people first, which is why Built In named Moveworks the #1 Best Place to Work in the Bay Area.

What you’ll do:

Work closely with Conversation framework experts, to understand and validate the latest Conversational API and best practices
Implement user-facing conversational functionality on top of the cutting edge Conversational AI support and best practices
Collaborate with PM, UX, ML, and Enterprise Platform teams to define, scope, and deliver strategic features
Scale the product to more customers, more domains, and around the globe.
Identify patterns and ideas to further advance the Conversational AI framework.
Potential to grow into product owner, or Conversational AI framework expert.

What you bring to the table:

BS or higher degree in computer science or a related field
2+ years of professional development experience building systems at scale
Good product sense and passion in building a scalable web or conversational UI product
Good cross-functional collaboration skills
A constant thirst for learning and a willingness to get out of your comfort zone

Nice to haves:

Experience with conversation flows and dialogs, and the ability to abstract out common patterns
API design and framework scalability (Abstraction of various chat clients and backend system integrations, globalization strategy, etc)
Exposure or interest in Machine Learning and probabilistic thinking
