full_text: Senior Software Engineer, Trust & Safety (T&S), Checkr, Inc., Orlando, FL, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 1 alum works here, 1 week ago, 0 applicants
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

This position is for our Tessera Data business, which is focused on building a safer future, online and offline, by providing valuable people data to drive informed trust and safety decisions. Our industry-leading data serves as the backbone for background checks used to protect a company’s employees, customers, and community. We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join their team that is highly collaborative and cares deeply about the mission of our company, is eager to work with a diverse team of engineers and has a quality-focused mindset. In this role, the Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for integration of the recently acquired background checks solution into Tessera in the near future, working on the data vendor integrations and evolving it into the identity verification platform long-term. The background check solution currently contains several public APIs, public and internal portals, and a handful of microservices. To be successful, this individual will work on integrating the acquired background check product into the Tessera ecosystem and will work on turning it into a solid foundation to build a complex identity verification solution.

We are a team of data explorers that thrive in acquiring, processing, and delivering data to solve trust and safety decisions! Join our team and be part of:
The industry leader in public records data aggregation and data classification/normalization
A collaborative environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally
An environment where your voice matters: Be vocal, we want to hear your ideas
A fun, creative, cooperative, and multicultural team

Responsibilities:
Own the product development from ideation, design, implementation, to release
Partner with the technical lead in designing and architecting new systems
Collaborate with the technical lead and remote team in implementation
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
Deliver performant, reliable, scalable, and secure code

What you bring:
5+ years experience as a software engineer working with .NET
Experience designing and implementing REST APIs
Experience building lambda based applications on AWS
Experience building CI/CD using Serverless, Cloudformation, Terraform or similar
Experience building asynchronous processing pipelines using message queuing systems such as AWS SQS/SNS, RabbitMQ, Kafka or similar
Experience working with both RDBMS and NoSQL data stores such as SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB
A strong understanding of microservice architecture infrastructure, inclusive of familiarity with Kubernetes
A passion for optimizing services for scale and speed
A great desire to learn, collaborate, improve, and innovate

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to $25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to 25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $122,103-$143,650 and within the city limits of NYC is $143,650 - $169,000.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Tessera

Tessera is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Tessera believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Tessera also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. full_text: Software Engineer - Android, Ramp, New York, NY, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, 401(k), Hide job, 1 alum works here, Promoted, Easy Apply
details:
Ramp is building the next generation of finance tools—from corporate cards and expense management, to bill payments and accounting integrations—designed to save businesses time and money with every click. More than 10,000 customers cut their expenses by 3.5% per year and closing their books 8x faster by switching to the Ramp platform.

Founded in 2019, Ramp powers the fastest-growing corporate card and bill payment software in America and enables billions of dollars of purchases each year. Ramp continues to grow at an increasingly large scale, more than doubling its revenue run rate in the first half of 2022.

Valued at $8.1 billion, Ramp's investors include Founders Fund, Stripe, Citi, Goldman Sachs, Coatue Management, D1 Capital Partners, Redpoint Ventures, General Catalyst, and Thrive Capital, as well as over 100 angel investors who were founders or executives of leading companies. The Ramp team comprises talented leaders from leading financial services and fintech companies—Stripe, Affirm, Goldman Sachs, American Express, Mastercard, Visa, Capital One—as well as technology companies such as Meta, Uber, Netflix, Twitter, Dropbox, and Instacart. Ramp was named Fast Company’s most innovative finance company in 2022.

About The Role

We are building our first Android app and we are looking for someone to design, build, and launch this app. You have a strong sense of ownership and enjoy owning projects from inception to scaling in production. As an early employee, you’ll be working with a nimble team of committed and talented engineers and have a large, long-term impact on technical design and engineering culture.

Check out our Engineering Blog for more on our tech stack, mission and values!

What You’ll Do

Design, build, and launch Ramp’s first Android app
Help establish and influence engineering processes, tools, and systems that allow us to scale the code base, productivity, and the team
Code review, set engineering standards, mentor, and own quality
Work with other engineers to build user-facing features as well as foundational systems for the app
Work with Product and Design to plan and identify key features to make the app successful
Work alongside product and business teams to understand customer feedback in order to constantly improve our product
Partner closely with our Talent team to recruit and hire amazing mobile engineers

What You Need

Preferred 4 years of software engineering experience with 2 years in mobile development
Proficiency in Kotlin for Android development
Strong understanding of mobile design patterns and best practices
Knowledge of Android UI components and Android SDK
Understanding of security best practices for mobile apps
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow, and master your craft
Drive to learn new technologies and adapt to different situations
Launched at least one mobile app or several features that reached a large number of users

Compensation

The annual salary/OTE range for the target level for this role in NYC is $175,950-$207,000 + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision, and 401(k)

Ramp Benefits (for U.S. Based Employees)

100% medical, dental & vision insurance coverage for you
Partially covered for your dependents
OneMedical annual membership
401k (including employer match)
Please note only 401k contributions made while employed by Ramp are eligible for an employer match
Unlimited PTO
Annual education reimbursement
WFH stipend to support your home office needs
Monthly wellness stipend; Headspace annual membership
Parental Leave
Relocation support

full_text: Senior Software Engineer, Trust & Safety (T&S), Checkr, Inc., Portland, OR, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 1 alum works here, 1 week ago, 1 applicant
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

This position is for our Tessera Data business, which is focused on building a safer future, online and offline, by providing valuable people data to drive informed trust and safety decisions. Our industry-leading data serves as the backbone for background checks used to protect a company’s employees, customers, and community. We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join their team that is highly collaborative and cares deeply about the mission of our company, is eager to work with a diverse team of engineers and has a quality-focused mindset. In this role, the Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for integration of the recently acquired background checks solution into Tessera in the near future, working on the data vendor integrations and evolving it into the identity verification platform long-term. The background check solution currently contains several public APIs, public and internal portals, and a handful of microservices. To be successful, this individual will work on integrating the acquired background check product into the Tessera ecosystem and will work on turning it into a solid foundation to build a complex identity verification solution.

We are a team of data explorers that thrive in acquiring, processing, and delivering data to solve trust and safety decisions! Join our team and be part of:
The industry leader in public records data aggregation and data classification/normalization
A collaborative environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally
An environment where your voice matters: Be vocal, we want to hear your ideas
A fun, creative, cooperative, and multicultural team

Responsibilities:
Own the product development from ideation, design, implementation, to release
Partner with the technical lead in designing and architecting new systems
Collaborate with the technical lead and remote team in implementation
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
Deliver performant, reliable, scalable, and secure code

What you bring:
5+ years experience as a software engineer working with .NET
Experience designing and implementing REST APIs
Experience building lambda based applications on AWS
Experience building CI/CD using Serverless, Cloudformation, Terraform or similar
Experience building asynchronous processing pipelines using message queuing systems such as AWS SQS/SNS, RabbitMQ, Kafka or similar
Experience working with both RDBMS and NoSQL data stores such as SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB
A strong understanding of microservice architecture infrastructure, inclusive of familiarity with Kubernetes
A passion for optimizing services for scale and speed
A great desire to learn, collaborate, improve, and innovate

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to $25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to 25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $122,103-$143,650 and within the city limits of NYC is $143,650 - $169,000.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Tessera

Tessera is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Tessera believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Tessera also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Tessera's commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

full_text: Senior Software Engineer - Growth (Martech), Ramp, New York, NY, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, 401(k), Hide job, 1 company alumnus works here, 1 day ago, Easy Apply
details:
Ramp is building the next generation of finance tools—from corporate cards and expense management, to bill payments and accounting integrations—designed to save businesses time and money with every click. More than 10,000 customers cut their expenses by 3.5% per year and closing their books 8x faster by switching to the Ramp platform.

Founded in 2019, Ramp powers the fastest-growing corporate card and bill payment software in America and enables billions of dollars of purchases each year. Ramp continues to grow at an increasingly large scale, more than doubling its revenue run rate in the first half of 2022.

Valued at $8.1 billion, Ramp's investors include Founders Fund, Stripe, Citi, Goldman Sachs, Coatue Management, D1 Capital Partners, Redpoint Ventures, General Catalyst, and Thrive Capital, as well as over 100 angel investors who were founders or executives of leading companies. The Ramp team comprises talented leaders from leading financial services and fintech companies—Stripe, Affirm, Goldman Sachs, American Express, Mastercard, Visa, Capital One—as well as technology companies such as Meta, Uber, Netflix, Twitter, Dropbox, and Instacart. Ramp was named Fast Company’s most innovative finance company in 2022.

About The Role

Ramp's Growth Engineering team ships software and infrastructure to acquire new business and expand existing business at scale. We experiment and analyze the best ways to grow and creativity is a must. We are a new and growing team so each individual will make an outsized impact. Learn more about our problem space and environment at our new engineering blog!

What You’ll Do

Grow Ramp to its next millions of users & hundreds of millions in revenue through growth & marketing technology.
Support our Marketing Technology, Growth Engineering, Data and Business Systems Teams by implementing, enhancing and transforming 3rd party tools and 1st party systems to meet our strategic technology goals.
Be a key partner to our Head of Martech to drive engineering-focused outcomes and support this team in delivering on projects, implementations, initiatives that require code.
Build and maintain mission-critical marketing systems through a mixture of 1st and 3rd party solutions. Example projects include:
Gracefully decommission an email delivery tool, and champion the technical work required to transition to a new 3rd party solution.
Drive the engineering scope and delivery of a unique, never-before-seen Internal CDP that combines 1st and 3rd party systems.
Maintain and improve our leads database, including upstream data capture, enrichment and asynchronous routing across internal built tools and a 3rd party, Madkudu.
Scope, build and help evangelize a core privacy database and safe, reliable front-end APIs for use across various departments to support our enterprise legal and compliance readiness.
Scope, build, and help evangelize a centralized repository for email marketing preferences that spans multiple 3rd party tools (outreach, SFDC, segment, hubspot and sendgrid) and that is accessible in many platform environments including anonymous front-end environments, and back-end authenticated web, iOS, and Android environments.
Re-image and build an updated marketing parameter system to capture a growing array of marketing URL strings, parse them with timestamps, and pass them to downstream tools. Collaborate with Business Systems to design and implement a better marketing and growth object, and update downstream systems, including Snowflake to ensure system capture and transition.
Save the day for Product, Growth, and Marketing teams by instrumenting core analytics, identity and other events on the front-end to quickly deliver on campaign needs.
Wherever possible, build automation and internal tools to support Growth and Marketing.
Be a subject matter expert in martech engineering, educating and guiding other engineers across the various teams as it relates to martech concepts including but not limited to:
3rd party analytics.
3rd and 1st party identification, how we anonymize users, identify them, alias their ids, and how this works in various tools.
Process for instrumentation and how to make schema on write viable as Ramp grows.
Capturing, processing, storing and transmitting marketing related parameters. How these parameters transverse our systems and how we transmit them to 1st and 3rd party tools. Be a key contact to other engineers who have questions and want to use martech to grow Ramp.

What You Need

A proven ability to write applications and high quality code for front-end, back-end systems.
A multi-disciplinary background, and understanding of how many 3rd party tools work, including Snowflake, Segment, Amplitude, Hubspot, Salesforce, DBT and Hightouch.
A dedication to first-principles problem-solving: you are as comfortable and supportive of implementing 3rd parties as you are of designing, building and maintaining 1st party solutions.
A desire to be a subject matter expert in a growing and deely technical field (martech).
Experience shipping fast, reliable, real-time applications using modern development tools and processes.
An interest in working with people as well as writing code.
A joy in serving & educating others, especially non-technical peers.

Nice to Haves

Start up experience as a technical co/founder, growth, or data roles.
Previous experience implementing the tools we use (Segment, Amplitude, Madkudu, Snowflake, Hubspot, Salesforce.com)
An understanding an appreciation for data privacy and application security.
Low/no ego.

Compensation

The annual salary/OTE range for the target level for this role in NYC is $182,750-$215,000 + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision, and 401(k)

full_text: Senior Software Engineer, Songbird Therapy, United States, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 2 months ago, 1 applicant
details:
About Songbird

Songbird Therapy is a modern and technology-enabled provider of in-home autism care and children's behavioral health. We're one of the fastest-growing consumer healthcare startups, and we're well-funded (>$10mm) by leaders in Silicon Valley and digital health, like Kleiner Perkins. Now, we're bringing together the best therapists and modern technology - building a world where every child can access world-class care, uniquely tailored to them.

What You'll Own

As the founding member of our engineering team, you'll have the opportunity to conceptualize and ship products end-to-end on a fast-moving team. You'll partner with the founders (both with backgrounds in software; previously at Facebook/Instacart), product leader, and an operations leader to ship products that dramatically improve the quality of care for children with autism. You'll heavily shape both our product strategy as well as our engineering processes, working in a self-directed manner to ensure you're working on the highest leverage problems. Your goal will be to help create a care delivery software platform that helps us elevate the standard of care for children with autism.

You Will

Own product development end-to-end: prioritizing and spec-ing out projects, full-stack development, integration testing, and customer interactions
Own full-stack development on the latest technologies: user interface and front-end development, backend APIs, infrastructure, and testing
Drive the product development for a care delivery software platform used by families and therapists, sometimes being your own product manager
Help set up and iterate on foundational engineering processes, including version control, integration testing, deployment infrastructure, and internal documentation
Take initiative, hustle, and fill in gaps—believing that nothing at Songbird is someone else's problem

What You Should Bring

3+ years of professional experience at a fast-moving startup, preferably with 1+ year owning an entire product area
Velocity—your peers know you to be in the top 10th percentile of engineering velocity and ability to get things done
Experience with modern web development across the stack, including: React, Typescript, Node.js, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, and more.
Proven ability to work in a self-directed manner, independently able to prioritize initiatives to optimize for impact
A past entrepreneurial proofpoint: founding or exploring ideas, build at an early-stage startup, or building a net new product and team at a larger company
Mission-driven, and excited to build products that change the daily lives of families

Values we live by

Motivated by supporting families. Our mission is to bring world-class, personalized care to children with autism—and that work energizes and inspires you.
Seek out and take ownership. You're hungry for impact and believe in seeking out opportunities to take ownership to solve problems and support others—even when it means questioning the way things are done.
Uplift others. You thrive in a team environment**.** You care about uplifting others and helping them succeed. You enable others' strengths and interests because you care.
Driven to move fast. You believe in moving fast to support your teammates and help bring early intervention to families in need—every day counts.
Embrace gratitude and adventure. You bring gratitude, humor and joy into your work, which elevates our team culture.

Benefits We Offer

Compassionate, energizing, and mission-driven culture of supporting families and innovation
10 paid national holidays
Competitive medical, vision dental, and life insurance
Opportunities for internal career growth
Remote-first culture, with options for coworking if desired
Competitive equity in fast-growing startup
Mission to support the most vulnerable families that's motivating daily

full_text: Enablement Program Manager, Onboarding & Everboarding, Amplitude, San Francisco Bay Area, Hybrid, Hide job, 2 company alumni work here, Promoted, 8 applicants
details:
Amplitude is a leading digital analytics platform. More than 1,800 customers, including Atlassian, Chick-fil-A, Marks & Spencer, NBCUniversal, PayPal, Shopify, and Under Armour rely on Amplitude to gain self-service visibility into the entire customer journey. With Amplitude, teams can understand what product features are working, where users are getting stuck, and what actions lead to the right outcomes. As an organization, we approach challenges with humility, take ownership of our contributions, and embrace a growth mindset that pushes us to constantly improve ourselves, each other, and the value we bring to customers and partners.

Amplitude’s Commitment to Diversity Equity & Inclusion (DEI): Amplitude believes that diversity enables creation of better products, ability to solve complex problems, and drive more powerful solutions. In order to make diversity possible, we commit to striving to create an environment of inclusion: an environment focused on psychological safety, empathy, and human connection, which will allow employees of all backgrounds to feel the care they need to thrive.

This position

As an Enablement Program Manager, you will be responsible for onboarding and focused everboarding initiatives to ensure that the global GTM teams are equipped with the content and skills to onboard and grow at Amplitude. You will design, create and deliver training, certification, and go-to-market performance improvement initiatives. You are passionate about GTM methodologies and processes, and thrive on helping others succeed. In this highly dynamic role you will be equal parts program manager, content developer, facilitator and Enablement business partner to our GTM organization. This role plays a critical part in supporting the GTM team to achieve its goals and ensuring the Enablement team meets the needs of the business.

This position reports to the Director, Global Enablement Programs

Responsibilities

Design, maintain, and facilitate go-to-market onboarding; partner with Field Effectiveness Enablement to support role-specific onboarding programs
Build both facilitated training and elearning series in our LMS
Oversee Quarterly Readiness Training, partnering with Marketing, Product, and Enablement teams to deliver streamlined training and updates to the go-to-market field
Build content to support the Customer Engagement Model
Support the maintenance of our learning- and content management systems
Assist with change management related to process and messaging updates
Support major go-to-market initiatives as needed
Define objectives and key results for each program, creating plans and overseeing program execution
Define, measure and communicate out the programs’ success metrics

Basic Qualifications

5+ years managing end-to-end enablement programs
2+ years in a customer-facing success or sales role
Knowledge of sales methodologies and processes
Ability to design and develop engaging and interactive training and content using a variety of modalities and methods
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience managing programs
Experience working on cross-functional projects across multiple teams
Experience working with content management systems (ie: Showpad, Highspot. Seismic) and learning management systems (ie: BrainShark, MindTickle, SkillJar)

Preferred Qualifications

Certification in methodology such as Sandler or MEDDPICC
Experience using authoring tools (ie: Articulate Rise/Storyline, Captivate, Adobe Premiere Pro, Camtasia)

The Product: Amplitude is a digital analytics platform – we help companies understand their users, rapidly release better product experiences, and ultimately grow their business. We’re super proud of what we’ve built and continue to expand: a platform that empowers companies to thrive in the digital era.

Other Fun Facts About Amplitude

G2: #1 product analytics solution and #3 best software product
Business Insider: A top tech company to bet your career on
Fast Company: #3 most innovative enterprise company in the world
Amplitude went public via a direct listing in September 2021 and is now trading under the ticker AMPL.
Founded in 2012, Amplitude is backed by Benchmark Capital, Sequoia Capital, IVP, Battery Ventures, Y Combinator and other top tier investors.
We’re a global and fast-growing team! We have offices in San Francisco (HQ), New York, Vancouver, Amsterdam, London, Paris, Singapore, and employees around the world.
Our mascot is the datamonster, who loves to chow down on numbers, charts, and graphs. Nom nom.

Amplitude provides equal employment opportunities (EEO). All applicants are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

full_text: Merchant Success Manager, DoorDash, Tempe, AZ, Medical benefit, Hide job, 1 connection works here, Promoted, Easy Apply
details:
About The Team

Inside Account Management is the organization within DoorDash that is dedicated to retention, satisfaction, and growth of our SMB merchant partners. We’re a team of sales, account management, onboarding, and solutions professionals predominantly located in Phoenix, AZ.

About The Role

The Merchant Success Manager is responsible for a merchant's long-term retention, engagement and overall satisfaction with DoorDash. You will cultivate our relationships with SMB business owners, while helping them craft a successful partnership with DoorDash. You will demonstrate a broad scope, including holding periodic business check-ins, making operational improvements, troubleshooting product-related bugs, recommending marketing strategies, and ensuring high levels of satisfaction and retention on a book of accounts. You will report to the Inside Sales Manager on our Inside Account Management team. This team works a hybrid schedule with some time in-office and some time remote.

You’re Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will…

Work with businesses to establish integral goals and key performance indicators for their business
Communicate with merchants via phone and email on an ongoing basis to monitor and support progress toward their business goals
Deliver quarterly business reviews that highlight key wins and areas of opportunity
Drive to reduce churn, while identifying and supporting new store expansions
Advocate internally for how to best solve your merchant’s objectives
Collaborate with internal growth teams to identify the best opportunities for merchants in your book of business to expand their sales

We’re Excited About You Because…

You have 1+ years of experience in client-facing roles, increasing customer satisfaction, retention, and product adoption
You have 1+ years of experience in business operations or related setting
You have proven success in prior sales, account management, portfolio management, or related roles
You have experience with using Salesforce or similar CRM tools
You have a demonstrated track record of empathizing with customer needs and adapting to meet their unique goals
You have the mindset of an owner in whatever you do, and strive to be 1% better everyday

About DoorDash

At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods.

DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce – people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.

If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.

Permanently Remote

Backed by the same folks behind Lime, Shift, Forward, Square, Instacart, Twilio, OpenDoor & SpaceX.

We are building the next generation of mental health care by leveraging data from IoT devices (e.g. smartphones, wearables) to offer truly personalized therapy experiences.

Our founder was on the early team at Calm, Oura & Akili (all $1B+ mental health companies) & understands how to translate raw sensor data from patients' smartphones into insights and predictions our therapists will use to guide treatment.

We've already signed 6 of the 7 largest insurance companies in the country at much higher pay rates than our competitors!

full_text: Amazon Software Engineer Career Coach (FAANG), Coachable, United States, Remote, Hide job, Your profile matches this job, 2 months ago, Easy Apply
details:
Software Engineer Career Coach (FAANG)

Coachable (formerly CodeBreakers) proudly helps new and seasoned software engineers land their dream jobs at some of America’s top tech companies. Our platform works with experienced FAANG engineers to provide mentorship opportunities to the next generation of FAANG engineers. Using our proven Coachable curriculum, we’ve successfully helped over 300 mentees land roles at Amazon, Facebook, and Google (just to name a few!) and have a placement rate of 93%!

What Makes Coachable Successful?

Engineers like YOU.

Because Coachable works with experienced software engineers across large tech companies (Google, Facebook, Twitter, Rivian, Amazon, etc), we know what it takes to land a role with one of the top tech companies in the world. Our team of experienced engineers works directly with the next generation of software engineers to prepare them for the next phase of their careers at top-performing tech companies.

Our mentors provide 1:1 weekly online coaching sessions designed to help mentees develop the skills and knowledge required to ace their interviews and land their dream job using our proven curriculum centered around our core beliefs of upholding the highest standards of innovation, opportunity, diversity, and diligence.

Together, Coachable and our team of FAANG experts guide mentees into the next phase of their careers and inspire future generations of software engineers to step outside of their comfort zones to land incredible opportunities and skyrocket their careers.

How Does Coaching Work?

At Coachable, we believe in innovation, opportunity, diversity, and diligence. That’s why we provide our coaches with a set curriculum that’s proven to help mentees successfully land a position with a top-tier tech company.

As a Coachable Software Engineer Career Coach, you’ll be tasked with guiding future FAANG engineers to success. You’ll provide weekly 1:1 online coaching sessions and cover topics such as programming and data structures.

Aside from helping mentees master technical skills, you’ll serve as a motivational figure who helps inspire mentees to step outside of their comfort zones while collaboratively working with other coaches to ensure the highest quality of coaching and mentee success.

Additionally, Software Engineer Career Coaches will:

Commit to 10 hours per week of coaching services (total of 40 hours per month)
Remain reliable and accessible for student questions and/or concerns
Appropriately prepare lessons for mentorship sessions prior to scheduled sessions
Collaborate with other mentors to ensure all student needs are adequately addressed
Provide support with job search initiatives and perform mock interviews
Uphold a welcoming and supportive learning environment

This position is a 1099 contract position that is unfortunately not available to individuals holding H1B or F1 Visas.

What Does It Take To Be A Coach?

Coachable is passionate about helping others succeed and achieve their dreams. That’s why we work with coaches who are highly experienced FAANG (or FAANG-equivalent) engineers with a passion for helping future generations of software engineers achieve their dreams.

Coaches should have a strong understanding of software engineering concepts and principles and should be comfortable teaching material to individuals of varying skill levels. This role requires that coaches are passionate about helping others grow and expand their technical skills and knowledge while upholding a supportive environment for learning.

Other important skills for this role include:

Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to explain complex concepts and ideas
Motivating and supportive demeanor with the ability to identify areas of improvement and additional support
High level of commitment and dedication with the ability to commit to scheduled sessions
Genuine interest in and enthusiasm for helping shape the next generation of software engineers
Successful personal completion of the SWE hiring process
Alignment with the mission and values of Coachable

Why Work With Coachable?

Coachable believes in helping others succeed, including our coaches! We offer a variety of benefits including:

Networking & Community: We provide a robust network of coaches to help you build a community filled with like-minded individuals.
Flexibility: Choose your schedule and commit to the hours that work best for you.
Tax Advantage Pay: Almost all coaching expenses can be used as tax write-offs.
Competitive Pay: Salary begins at $80-$120 per hour based on experience with the option to receive bonus pay for working more than 40 hours per month.
Growth Opportunities: Wage and performance evaluations every 3 months to help you increase your revenue and meet your personal goals.
Events: Join us at one of our many Coachable events and/or dinners in Seattle, San Francisco, Boston, or New York City!

About Coachable

Coachable believes that all dreams are achievable. That’s why we invest in helping future FAANG engineers land positions at top-tier tech companies. Our proven curriculum helps guide new and seasoned engineers to success. With a placement rate of over 93% and an average starting salary of $145,000, Coachable knows what it takes to snag a position at a top-notch FAANG company.

Requirements:

Current or previous software engineering experience at a large FAANG+ company. We’ve hired engineers from companies like Instacart, Robinhood, Tesla, etc.
Ability to commit to 10 hours of coaching sessions per week
Positive and supportive approach to mentorship
Experience with traditional software engineering technical interview process and successfully navigating FAANG-level technical interviews

Coachable is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other legally protected characteristics.

full_text: Senior Software Engineer, Trust & Safety (T&S), Checkr, Inc., Philadelphia, PA, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 1 alum works here, 1 week ago, 0 applicants
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

This position is for our Tessera Data business, which is focused on building a safer future, online and offline, by providing valuable people data to drive informed trust and safety decisions. Our industry-leading data serves as the backbone for background checks used to protect a company’s employees, customers, and community. We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join their team that is highly collaborative and cares deeply about the mission of our company, is eager to work with a diverse team of engineers and has a quality-focused mindset. In this role, the Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for integration of the recently acquired background checks solution into Tessera in the near future, working on the data vendor integrations and evolving it into the identity verification platform long-term. The background check solution currently contains several public APIs, public and internal portals, and a handful of microservices. To be successful, this individual will work on integrating the acquired background check product into the Tessera ecosystem and will work on turning it into a solid foundation to build a complex identity verification solution.

We are a team of data explorers that thrive in acquiring, processing, and delivering data to solve trust and safety decisions! Join our team and be part of:
The industry leader in public records data aggregation and data classification/normalization
A collaborative environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally
An environment where your voice matters: Be vocal, we want to hear your ideas
A fun, creative, cooperative, and multicultural team

Responsibilities:
Own the product development from ideation, design, implementation, to release
Partner with the technical lead in designing and architecting new systems
Collaborate with the technical lead and remote team in implementation
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
Deliver performant, reliable, scalable, and secure code

What you bring:
5+ years experience as a software engineer working with .NET
Experience designing and implementing REST APIs
Experience building lambda based applications on AWS
Experience building CI/CD using Serverless, Cloudformation, Terraform or similar
Experience building asynchronous processing pipelines using message queuing systems such as AWS SQS/SNS, RabbitMQ, Kafka or similar
Experience working with both RDBMS and NoSQL data stores such as SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB
A strong understanding of microservice architecture infrastructure, inclusive of familiarity with Kubernetes
A passion for optimizing services for scale and speed
A great desire to learn, collaborate, improve, and innovate

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to $25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to 25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $122,103-$143,650 and within the city limits of NYC is $143,650 - $169,000.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Tessera

Tessera is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Tessera believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Tessera also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Tessera's commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

full_text: REMOTE - Senior React Native Engineer, CyberCoders, Los Angeles, CA, Remote, $150K/yr - $200K/yr, Hide job, Actively recruiting, 5 days ago, 15 applicants, Easy Apply
details:
If you are a Senior React Native Engineer or willing to learn it, please read on!

Job Title: Senior React Native Engineer

Salary: $150,000-$200,000/yr + Equity, Benefits

Permanently Remote

Backed by the same folks behind Lime, Shift, Forward, Square, Instacart, Twilio, OpenDoor & SpaceX.

We are building the next generation of mental health care by leveraging data from IoT devices (e.g. smartphones, wearables) to offer truly personalized therapy experiences.

Our founder was on the early team at Calm, Oura & Akili (all $1B+ mental health companies) & understands how to translate raw sensor data from patients' smartphones into insights and predictions our therapists will use to guide treatment.

We've already signed 6 of the 7 largest insurance companies in the country at much higher pay rates than our competitors!

This Senior Mobile Engineer role is an opportunity to work side-by-side with the CEO to build new systems that save lives.

We're looking for a seasoned mobile engineer to take ownership of our mobile applications (built primarily with React Native), to change the way therapy is delivered across the United States.

If you have this experience, please apply immediately. We are actively interviewing this week and next for this high-profile position.

What's In It for You
You are creating from close to scratch (we have an MVP)
Significant Equity (full percentage point(s))
Competitive Compensation D.O.E.
Working with a technical CEO & building on a modern tech stack
Mission driven company and culture
Top Tier Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision 100% covered for employee)
Work remotely with Equipment & Supplies Paid for, Monthly Wellness Spend, Continuous Learning Spend
What You Need for this Position

Required
5+ years of experience as a software engineer.
Prior startup experience at a fast-growing, early-stage, technology company.
2+ years of experience using React Native in a released application on iOS and Android. If you do not have React Native experience, you must be willing to learn.
2+ years of experience writing JavaScript code regardless of the flavor, i.e., TypeScript.
Recent experience building mobile applications is required. You should have contributed to iOS and Android applications within the last year.
Preferred
Experience building mobile applications for a healthcare company, including handling sensitive patient data and ensuring HIPAA compliance.
Experience doing passive data collection from users using iOS and Android applications.
Love the experience of autonomy, mastery, and purpose that comes with joining a fast-moving startup and owning the mobile application experience.
So, if you are a Senior React Native Engineer with experience, please apply today!

Colorado employees will receive paid sick leave. For additional information about available benefits, please contact Taylor McAlister

If you are a Senior React Native Engineer or willing to learn it, please read on!

Job Title: Senior React Native Engineer

Salary: $150,000-$200,000/yr + Equity, Benefits

Permanently Remote

Backed by the same folks behind Lime, Shift, Forward, Square, Instacart, Twilio, OpenDoor & SpaceX.

We are building the next generation of mental health care by leveraging data from IoT devices (e.g. smartphones, wearables) to offer truly personalized therapy experiences.

Our founder was on the early team at Calm, Oura & Akili (all $1B+ mental health companies) & understands how to translate raw sensor data from patients' smartphones into insights and predictions our therapists will use to guide treatment.

We've already signed 6 of the 7 largest insurance companies in the country at much higher pay rates than our competitors!

This Senior Mobile Engineer role is an opportunity to work side-by-side with the CEO to build new systems that save lives.

We're looking for a seasoned mobile engineer to take ownership of our mobile applications (built primarily with React Native), to change the way therapy is delivered across the United States.

If you have this experience, please apply immediately. We are actively interviewing this week and next for this high-profile position.

What's In It for You
You are creating from close to scratch (we have an MVP)
Significant Equity (full percentage point(s))
Competitive Compensation D.O.E.
Working with a technical CEO & building on a modern tech stack
Mission driven company and culture
Top Tier Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision 100% covered for employee)
Work remotely with Equipment & Supplies Paid for, Monthly Wellness Spend, Continuous Learning Spend
What You Need for this Position

Required
5+ years of experience as a software engineer.
Prior startup experience at a fast-growing, early-stage, technology company.
2+ years of experience using React Native in a released application on iOS and Android. If you do not have React Native experience, you must be willing to learn.
2+ years of experience writing JavaScript code regardless of the flavor, i.e., TypeScript.
Recent experience building mobile applications is required. You should have contributed to iOS and Android applications within the last year.
Preferred
Experience building mobile applications for a healthcare company, including handling sensitive patient data and ensuring HIPAA compliance.
Experience doing passive data collection from users using iOS and Android applications.
Love the experience of autonomy, mastery, and purpose that comes with joining a fast-moving startup and owning the mobile application experience.
So, if you are a Senior React Native Engineer with experience, please apply today!

full_text: Software Engineer Career Mentor (FAANG), Coachable, United States, Remote, $60/hr - $100/hr, Hide job, Actively recruiting, 3 days ago, Easy Apply
details:
Software Engineer Career Mentor (FAANG)

Coachable (formerly CodeBreakers) proudly helps new and seasoned software engineers land their dream jobs at some of America’s top tech companies. Our platform works with experienced FAANG engineers to provide mentorship opportunities to the next generation of FAANG engineers. Using our proven Coachable curriculum, we’ve successfully helped over 300 mentees land roles at Amazon, Facebook, and Google (just to name a few!) and have a placement rate of 93%!

What Makes Coachable Successful?

Engineers like YOU.

Because Coachable works with experienced software engineers across large tech companies (Google, Facebook, Twitter, Rivian, Amazon, etc), we know what it takes to land a role with one of the top tech companies in the world. Our team of experienced engineers works directly with the next generation of software engineers to prepare them for the next phase of their careers at top-performing tech companies.

Our mentors provide 1:1 weekly online coaching sessions designed to help mentees develop the skills and knowledge required to ace their interviews and land their dream job using our proven curriculum centered around our core beliefs of upholding the highest standards of innovation, opportunity, diversity, and diligence.

Together, Coachable and our team of FAANG experts guide mentees into the next phase of their careers and inspire future generations of software engineers to step outside of their comfort zones to land incredible opportunities and skyrocket their careers.

How Does Coaching Work?

At Coachable, we believe in innovation, opportunity, diversity, and diligence. That’s why we provide our coaches with a set curriculum that’s proven to help mentees successfully land a position with a top-tier tech company.

As a Coachable Software Engineer Career Mentor, you’ll be tasked with guiding future FAANG engineers to success. You’ll provide weekly 1:1 online coaching sessions and cover topics such as programming and data structures.

Aside from helping mentees master technical skills, you’ll serve as a motivational figure who helps inspire mentees to step outside of their comfort zones while collaboratively working with other coaches to ensure the highest quality of coaching and mentee success.

Additionally, Software Engineer Career Coaches will:

Commit to 10 hours per week of coaching services (total of 40 hours per month)
Remain reliable and accessible for student questions and/or concerns
Appropriately prepare lessons for mentorship sessions prior to scheduled sessions
Collaborate with other mentors to ensure all student needs are adequately addressed
Provide support with job search initiatives and perform mock interviews
Uphold a welcoming and supportive learning environment

This position is a 1099 contract position that is unfortunately not available to individuals holding H1B or F1 Visas.

What Does It Take To Be A Mentor?

Coachable is passionate about helping others succeed and achieve their dreams. That’s why we work with coaches who are highly experienced FAANG (or FAANG-equivalent) engineers with a passion for helping future generations of software engineers achieve their dreams.

Coaches should have a strong understanding of software engineering concepts and principles and should be comfortable teaching material to individuals of varying skill levels. This role requires that coaches are passionate about helping others grow and expand their technical skills and knowledge while upholding a supportive environment for learning.

Other important skills for this role include:

Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to explain complex concepts and ideas
Motivating and supportive demeanor with the ability to identify areas of improvement and additional support
High level of commitment and dedication with the ability to commit to scheduled sessions
Genuine interest in and enthusiasm for helping shape the next generation of software engineers
Successful personal completion of the SWE hiring process
Alignment with the mission and values of Coachable

Why Work With Coachable?

Coachable believes in helping others succeed, including our coaches! We offer a variety of benefits including:

Networking & Community: We provide a robust network of coaches to help you build a community filled with like-minded individuals.
Flexibility: Choose your schedule and commit to the hours that work best for you.
Tax Advantage Pay: Almost all coaching expenses can be used as tax write-offs.
Competitive Pay: Salary begins at $80-$120 per hour based on experience with the option to receive bonus pay for working more than 40 hours per month.
Growth Opportunities: Wage and performance evaluations every 3 months to help you increase your revenue and meet your personal goals.
Events: Join us at one of our many Coachable events and/or dinners in Seattle, San Francisco, Boston, or New York City!

About Coachable

Coachable believes that all dreams are achievable. That’s why we invest in helping future FAANG engineers land positions at top-tier tech companies. Our proven curriculum helps guide new and seasoned engineers to success. With a placement rate of over 93% and an average starting salary of $145,000, Coachable knows what it takes to snag a position at a top-notch FAANG company.

Requirements:

Current or previous software engineering experience at a large FAANG+ company. We’ve hired engineers from companies like Instacart, Robinhood, Tesla, etc.
Ability to commit to 10 hours of coaching sessions per week
Positive and supportive approach to mentorship
Experience with traditional software engineering technical interview process and successfully navigating FAANG-level technical interviews

Coachable is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other legally protected characteristics.

full_text: Senior Solutions Engineer, Checkr, Inc., Raleigh, NC, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, Actively recruiting, 1 week ago, 9 applicants
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

Solutions Engineer

Checkr’s Solutions Engineering Team are strategic partners to our Sales and Implementation Teams. They are responsible for working with our most complex prospects to design and develop unique solutions that enhance trust and safety in the hiring process. Solutions Engineers at Checkr are experienced problem solvers with a background in Solutions Engineering, Customer Success, Technical Account Management, Client Consulting, and understand how technology delivers business value. You will be responsible for providing pre-sales support for our most valuable prospects and partners.

Responsibilities:

As a Solutions Engineer, you will strategically partner with the Sales Team to:
Meet with business leaders at prospect companies to understand their business goals and articulate Checkr’s value proposition
Meet with stakeholders across the organization, from C-Level executives to frontline employees and tailor your messaging to these audiences
Shape value creation for our clients through presentations, case studies, product demonstrations, pilots, solution designs, and proposals
Educate our prospective clients on safe hiring best practices, explaining how other Checkr customers have approached obstacles and challenges, and generally serving as the trust & safety experts during sales cycles
Answer technical and compliance questions from our prospects and partners
Distill and communicate customer needs to the Product team and help drive product roadmap
Collaborate with Marketing on Case Studies, Use Cases and Marketing Events

What you bring:
2-5 years in related industry or SAAS
Mastery of the technical sales process, solution design, and proof of value execution
Expertise in discovery conversations, value-based selling, and world class demonstration and storytelling skills
Technical curiosity and knowledge of RESTful APIs or willingness to learn
Experience building rapport and working with cross functional teams spanning sales, product management, product marketing and business development
Ability to juggle and complete multiple priorities and projects (both internal and external) in a fast-paced environment
Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
Willingness and Ability to travel as needed (30% or higher)

What you get:
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental and vision coverage
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $101,150.40 - $119,000 and within the city limits of NYC is $119,000-$140,000. This position is also eligible to participate in Checkr’s commission plan/bonus plan

Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr

Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr’s commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

We are building the next generation of mental health care by leveraging data from IoT devices (e.g. smartphones, wearables) to offer truly personalized therapy experiences.

Our founder was on the early team at Calm, Oura & Akili (all $1B+ mental health companies) & understands how to translate raw sensor data from patients' smartphones into insights and predictions our therapists will use to guide treatment.

We've already signed 6 of the 7 largest insurance companies in the country at much higher pay rates than our competitors!

This Senior Mobile Engineer role is an opportunity to work side-by-side with the CEO to build new systems that save lives.

We're looking for a seasoned mobile engineer to take ownership of our mobile applications (built primarily with React Native), to change the way therapy is delivered across the United States.

If you have this experience, please apply immediately. We are actively interviewing this week and next for this high-profile position.

What's In It for You
You are creating from close to scratch (we have an MVP)
Significant Equity (full percentage point(s))

Mission driven company and culture
Top Tier Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision 100% covered for employee)

What You Need for this Position

Required
5+ years of experience as a software engineer.
Prior startup experience at a fast-growing, early-stage, technology company.
2+ years of experience using React Native in a released application on iOS and Android. If you do not have React Native experience, you must be willing to learn.
2+ years of experience writing JavaScript code regardless of the flavor, i.e., TypeScript.

full_text: Software Engineer Career Coach (FAANG), Coachable, United States, Remote, $60/hr - $100/hr, Hide job, Your profile matches this job, 3 weeks ago, Easy Apply
details:
Software Engineer Career Coach (FAANG)

Coachable (formerly CodeBreakers) proudly helps new and seasoned software engineers land their dream jobs at some of America’s top tech companies. Our platform works with experienced FAANG engineers to provide mentorship opportunities to the next generation of FAANG engineers. Using our proven Coachable curriculum, we’ve successfully helped over 300 mentees land roles at Amazon, Facebook, and Google (just to name a few!) and have a placement rate of 93%!

What Makes Coachable Successful?

Engineers like YOU.

Because Coachable works with experienced software engineers across large tech companies (Google, Facebook, Twitter, Rivian, Amazon, etc), we know what it takes to land a role with one of the top tech companies in the world. Our team of experienced engineers works directly with the next generation of software engineers to prepare them for the next phase of their careers at top-performing tech companies.

Our mentors provide 1:1 weekly online coaching sessions designed to help mentees develop the skills and knowledge required to ace their interviews and land their dream job using our proven curriculum centered around our core beliefs of upholding the highest standards of innovation, opportunity, diversity, and diligence.

Together, Coachable and our team of FAANG experts guide mentees into the next phase of their careers and inspire future generations of software engineers to step outside of their comfort zones to land incredible opportunities and skyrocket their careers.

How Does Coaching Work?

At Coachable, we believe in innovation, opportunity, diversity, and diligence. That’s why we provide our coaches with a set curriculum that’s proven to help mentees successfully land a position with a top-tier tech company.

As a Coachable Software Engineer Career Coach, you’ll be tasked with guiding future FAANG engineers to success. You’ll provide weekly 1:1 online coaching sessions and cover topics such as programming and data structures.

Aside from helping mentees master technical skills, you’ll serve as a motivational figure who helps inspire mentees to step outside of their comfort zones while collaboratively working with other coaches to ensure the highest quality of coaching and mentee success.

Additionally, Software Engineer Career Coaches will:

Commit to 10 hours per week of coaching services (total of 40 hours per month)
Remain reliable and accessible for student questions and/or concerns
Appropriately prepare lessons for mentorship sessions prior to scheduled sessions
Collaborate with other mentors to ensure all student needs are adequately addressed
Provide support with job search initiatives and perform mock interviews
Uphold a welcoming and supportive learning environment

This position is a 1099 contract position that is unfortunately not available to individuals holding H1B or F1 Visas.

What Does It Take To Be A Coach?

Coachable is passionate about helping others succeed and achieve their dreams. That’s why we work with coaches who are highly experienced FAANG (or FAANG-equivalent) engineers with a passion for helping future generations of software engineers achieve their dreams.

Coaches should have a strong understanding of software engineering concepts and principles and should be comfortable teaching material to individuals of varying skill levels. This role requires that coaches are passionate about helping others grow and expand their technical skills and knowledge while upholding a supportive environment for learning.

Other important skills for this role include:

Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to explain complex concepts and ideas
Motivating and supportive demeanor with the ability to identify areas of improvement and additional support
High level of commitment and dedication with the ability to commit to scheduled sessions
Genuine interest in and enthusiasm for helping shape the next generation of software engineers
Successful personal completion of the SWE hiring process
Alignment with the mission and values of Coachable

Why Work With Coachable?

Coachable believes in helping others succeed, including our coaches! We offer a variety of benefits including:

Networking & Community: We provide a robust network of coaches to help you build a community filled with like-minded individuals.
Flexibility: Choose your schedule and commit to the hours that work best for you.
Tax Advantage Pay: Almost all coaching expenses can be used as tax write-offs.
Competitive Pay: Salary begins at $80-$120 per hour based on experience with the option to receive bonus pay for working more than 40 hours per month.
Growth Opportunities: Wage and performance evaluations every 3 months to help you increase your revenue and meet your personal goals.
Events: Join us at one of our many Coachable events and/or dinners in Seattle, San Francisco, Boston, or New York City!

About Coachable

Coachable believes that all dreams are achievable. That’s why we invest in helping future FAANG engineers land positions at top-tier tech companies. Our proven curriculum helps guide new and seasoned engineers to success. With a placement rate of over 93% and an average starting salary of $145,000, Coachable knows what it takes to snag a position at a top-notch FAANG company.

Requirements:

Current or previous software engineering experience at a large FAANG+ company. We’ve hired engineers from companies like Instacart, Robinhood, Tesla, etc.
Ability to commit to 10 hours of coaching sessions per week
Positive and supportive approach to mentorship
Experience with traditional software engineering technical interview process and successfully navigating FAANG-level technical interviews

Coachable is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other legally protected characteristics.

full_text: Senior Solutions Engineer, Checkr, Inc., Atlanta, GA, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 1 alum works here, 1 week ago, 10 applicants
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

Solutions Engineer

Checkr’s Solutions Engineering Team are strategic partners to our Sales and Implementation Teams. They are responsible for working with our most complex prospects to design and develop unique solutions that enhance trust and safety in the hiring process. Solutions Engineers at Checkr are experienced problem solvers with a background in Solutions Engineering, Customer Success, Technical Account Management, Client Consulting, and understand how technology delivers business value. You will be responsible for providing pre-sales support for our most valuable prospects and partners.

Responsibilities:

As a Solutions Engineer, you will strategically partner with the Sales Team to:
Meet with business leaders at prospect companies to understand their business goals and articulate Checkr’s value proposition
Meet with stakeholders across the organization, from C-Level executives to frontline employees and tailor your messaging to these audiences
Shape value creation for our clients through presentations, case studies, product demonstrations, pilots, solution designs, and proposals
Educate our prospective clients on safe hiring best practices, explaining how other Checkr customers have approached obstacles and challenges, and generally serving as the trust & safety experts during sales cycles
Answer technical and compliance questions from our prospects and partners
Distill and communicate customer needs to the Product team and help drive product roadmap
Collaborate with Marketing on Case Studies, Use Cases and Marketing Events

What you bring:
2-5 years in related industry or SAAS
Mastery of the technical sales process, solution design, and proof of value execution
Expertise in discovery conversations, value-based selling, and world class demonstration and storytelling skills
Technical curiosity and knowledge of RESTful APIs or willingness to learn
Experience building rapport and working with cross functional teams spanning sales, product management, product marketing and business development
Ability to juggle and complete multiple priorities and projects (both internal and external) in a fast-paced environment
Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
Willingness and Ability to travel as needed (30% or higher)

What you get:
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental and vision coverage
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $101,150.40 - $119,000 and within the city limits of NYC is $119,000-$140,000. This position is also eligible to participate in Checkr’s commission plan/bonus plan

Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr

Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr’s commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.
