Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:

Taylor.McAlister@CyberCoders.com
Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : TM4-1718086L078 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***
Taylor McAlister - Sr. Executive Recruiter - CyberCoders

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

full_text: Software Engineer Career Coach (FAANG), Coachable, United States, Remote, $80/hr - $100/hr, Hide job, Actively recruiting, 2 months ago, Easy Apply
details:
Software Engineer Career Coach (FAANG)

Coachable (formerly CodeBreakers) proudly helps new and seasoned software engineers land their dream jobs at some of America’s top tech companies. Our platform works with experienced FAANG engineers to provide mentorship opportunities to the next generation of FAANG engineers. Using our proven Coachable curriculum, we’ve successfully helped over 300 mentees land roles at Amazon, Facebook, and Google (just to name a few!) and have a placement rate of 93%!

What Makes Coachable Successful?

Engineers like YOU.

Because Coachable works with experienced software engineers across large tech companies (Google, Facebook, Twitter, Rivian, Amazon, etc), we know what it takes to land a role with one of the top tech companies in the world. Our team of experienced engineers works directly with the next generation of software engineers to prepare them for the next phase of their careers at top-performing tech companies.

Our mentors provide 1:1 weekly online coaching sessions designed to help mentees develop the skills and knowledge required to ace their interviews and land their dream job using our proven curriculum centered around our core beliefs of upholding the highest standards of innovation, opportunity, diversity, and diligence.

Together, Coachable and our team of FAANG experts guide mentees into the next phase of their careers and inspire future generations of software engineers to step outside of their comfort zones to land incredible opportunities and skyrocket their careers.

How Does Coaching Work?

At Coachable, we believe in innovation, opportunity, diversity, and diligence. That’s why we provide our coaches with a set curriculum that’s proven to help mentees successfully land a position with a top-tier tech company.

As a Coachable Software Engineer Career Coach, you’ll be tasked with guiding future FAANG engineers to success. You’ll provide weekly 1:1 online coaching sessions and cover topics such as programming and data structures.

Aside from helping mentees master technical skills, you’ll serve as a motivational figure who helps inspire mentees to step outside of their comfort zones while collaboratively working with other coaches to ensure the highest quality of coaching and mentee success.

Additionally, Software Engineer Career Coaches will:

Commit to 10 hours per week of coaching services (total of 40 hours per month)
Remain reliable and accessible for student questions and/or concerns
Appropriately prepare lessons for mentorship sessions prior to scheduled sessions
Collaborate with other mentors to ensure all student needs are adequately addressed
Provide support with job search initiatives and perform mock interviews
Uphold a welcoming and supportive learning environment

This position is a 1099 contract position that is unfortunately not available to individuals holding H1B or F1 Visas.

What Does It Take To Be A Coach?

Coachable is passionate about helping others succeed and achieve their dreams. That’s why we work with coaches who are highly experienced FAANG (or FAANG-equivalent) engineers with a passion for helping future generations of software engineers achieve their dreams.

Coaches should have a strong understanding of software engineering concepts and principles and should be comfortable teaching material to individuals of varying skill levels. This role requires that coaches are passionate about helping others grow and expand their technical skills and knowledge while upholding a supportive environment for learning.

Other important skills for this role include:

Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to explain complex concepts and ideas
Motivating and supportive demeanor with the ability to identify areas of improvement and additional support
High level of commitment and dedication with the ability to commit to scheduled sessions
Genuine interest in and enthusiasm for helping shape the next generation of software engineers
Successful personal completion of the SWE hiring process
Alignment with the mission and values of Coachable

Why Work With Coachable?

Coachable believes in helping others succeed, including our coaches! We offer a variety of benefits including:

Networking & Community: We provide a robust network of coaches to help you build a community filled with like-minded individuals.
Flexibility: Choose your schedule and commit to the hours that work best for you.
Tax Advantage Pay: Almost all coaching expenses can be used as tax write-offs.
Competitive Pay: Salary begins at $80-$120 per hour based on experience with the option to receive bonus pay for working more than 40 hours per month.
Growth Opportunities: Wage and performance evaluations every 3 months to help you increase your revenue and meet your personal goals.
Events: Join us at one of our many Coachable events and/or dinners in Seattle, San Francisco, Boston, or New York City!

About Coachable

Coachable believes that all dreams are achievable. That’s why we invest in helping future FAANG engineers land positions at top-tier tech companies. Our proven curriculum helps guide new and seasoned engineers to success. With a placement rate of over 93% and an average starting salary of $145,000, Coachable knows what it takes to snag a position at a top-notch FAANG company.

Requirements:

Current or previous software engineering experience at a large FAANG+ company. We’ve hired engineers from companies like Instacart, Robinhood, Tesla, etc.
Ability to commit to 10 hours of coaching sessions per week
Positive and supportive approach to mentorship
Experience with traditional software engineering technical interview process and successfully navigating FAANG-level technical interviews

Coachable is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other legally protected characteristics.

full_text: Staff Frontend Engineer, Collective, San Francisco, CA, Remote, Hide job, Actively recruiting, 1 month ago, 3 applicants
details:
About Collective:

Collective is on a mission to redefine the way businesses-of-one work. Collective's technology and team of trusted advisors enables our members to achieve financial independence by taking care of everything from business incorporation to accounting, bookkeeping, tax services and access to a thriving community, all in one integrated platform. We believe in empowering self-employed people to enjoy the same tax savings that big companies get.

Featured in Forbes, Business Insider, Yahoo, Bloomberg, Financial Times, Techcrunch and more. We're backed by General Catalyst, Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher and Guy Oseary), QED Investors, Google's Gradient Ventures, Expa and prominent investors who have financed and built iconic companies like YouTube, Substack, Twitch, Box, Hims, Instacart, Lyft, and more.

About the role:

We are building the customer experience that scales Collective's primary offerings - Onboarding, Bookkeeping, Payroll and Taxes. The role offers an exciting opportunity to be the architect of the frontend of these core products. You will be part of a high-impact set of teams that builds the application used for our customers and for internal operations.

Responsibilities:
Craft the v1 architecture for Collective FE component system that delivers more complex interactions while maintaining a consistent experience with regards to style, maintainability and reusability
Work cross-functionally with product, design, and other engineering counterparts to novel products and features that our users will love
Ensure timely delivery of complex, multi-disciplinary, and highly visible projects by participating in the full development cycle: technical design, development, test, experimentation, analysis, and launch
Contribute to standards that improve developer workflows, recommend best practices, and mentor junior engineers to grow their technical expertise. Participate in writing design docs and reviewing code
Work closely with product and design giving feedback on specs and mocks

What we want you to bring:

We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements
Have 8+ years of experience developing user facing applications with React or another modern JavaScript web framework (VueJS, Angular, Ember, etc.)
A solid understanding in core web and browser concepts (e.g. how the browser parses and constructs a web page) and web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and core JavaScript concepts
Previously been in a technical leadership role driving work for large groups of engineers
A track record of mentoring senior engineers
A passion for working with users, building great user experience spanning web and mobile
Comfortable working in a highly agile, intensely iterative software development process
An appreciation for the importance of good documentation - internal and external
Attention to detail, especially around performance, accessibility, reliability and security

Preferred Requirements
Has shipped React components to be embedded by other external applications
Experience working with a remote team
Experience working with a global or otherwise multicultural team
Entrepreneurial spirit - you are self-directed, innovative, and biased towards action in fast-paced environments
You love to build new things and thrive in ambiguity and even failure

Equal Employment Opportunity

At Collective, we don't just accept differences — we celebrate them, we support them, and we thrive on them for the benefit of our employees, our customers, and our community. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. If you're good at what you do, come as you are. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. Collective is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

full_text: Senior Solutions Engineer, Checkr, Inc., Fort Lauderdale, FL, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 1 alum works here, 1 week ago, 6 applicants
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

Solutions Engineer

Checkr’s Solutions Engineering Team are strategic partners to our Sales and Implementation Teams. They are responsible for working with our most complex prospects to design and develop unique solutions that enhance trust and safety in the hiring process. Solutions Engineers at Checkr are experienced problem solvers with a background in Solutions Engineering, Customer Success, Technical Account Management, Client Consulting, and understand how technology delivers business value. You will be responsible for providing pre-sales support for our most valuable prospects and partners.

Responsibilities:

As a Solutions Engineer, you will strategically partner with the Sales Team to:
Meet with business leaders at prospect companies to understand their business goals and articulate Checkr’s value proposition
Meet with stakeholders across the organization, from C-Level executives to frontline employees and tailor your messaging to these audiences
Shape value creation for our clients through presentations, case studies, product demonstrations, pilots, solution designs, and proposals
Educate our prospective clients on safe hiring best practices, explaining how other Checkr customers have approached obstacles and challenges, and generally serving as the trust & safety experts during sales cycles
Answer technical and compliance questions from our prospects and partners
Distill and communicate customer needs to the Product team and help drive product roadmap
Collaborate with Marketing on Case Studies, Use Cases and Marketing Events

What you bring:
2-5 years in related industry or SAAS
Mastery of the technical sales process, solution design, and proof of value execution
Expertise in discovery conversations, value-based selling, and world class demonstration and storytelling skills
Technical curiosity and knowledge of RESTful APIs or willingness to learn
Experience building rapport and working with cross functional teams spanning sales, product management, product marketing and business development
Ability to juggle and complete multiple priorities and projects (both internal and external) in a fast-paced environment
Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
Willingness and Ability to travel as needed (30% or higher)

What you get:
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental and vision coverage
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $101,150.40 - $119,000 and within the city limits of NYC is $119,000-$140,000. This position is also eligible to participate in Checkr’s commission plan/bonus plan

Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr

Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr’s commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

Current or previous software engineering experience at a large FAANG+ company. We’ve hired engineers from companies like Instacart, Robinhood, Tesla, etc.
Ability to commit to 10 hours of coaching sessions per week
Positive and supportive approach to mentorship
Experience with traditional software engineering technical interview process and successfully navigating FAANG-level technical interviews

Coachable is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other legally protected characteristics.

full_text: Senior Full Stack WordPress Developer, Flickerbox, Inc., Portland, OR, Medical, Vision, Dental, 401(k), Hide job, Your profile matches this job, 2 weeks ago, 5 applicants, Easy Apply
details:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
As a member of the Flickerbox development team, you will contribute to world class organizations, doing the best work of your life with a team invested in your success.

Responsibilities

Write thoughtful and easily maintained code as part of a larger development team
Make decisions about architecture and implementation to meet client needs effectively
Plan and lead projects of varying complexity
Participate in gathering requirements and providing estimates of development scope
Describe technically nuanced concepts in easy to understand terms to non-technical audiences

Qualifications

Working knowledge of WordPress 6.x+ plugin and theme development using custom Gutenberg blocks
Proven experience and comfort developing for front-end UI and the back-end services that make it work
Demonstrable skill in PHP and JavaScript
Problem solver with a track record of working collaboratively
Experience with modern web development. Some of our favorite things include, but are not limited to: Symfony, Vue.js, React, Webpack, Sass, PHPCS, GitHub Actions, and Pantheon/WP Engine/Netlify
Adept at learning new technologies and sharing knowledge with others

Bonus Points

Open source contributions to WordPress, Drupal, or other PHP-based projects
Expertise in Vue.js, React, or Next.js
Development experience with common marketing tools: HubSpot, Marketo, Salesforce, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, OneTrust

Benefits

Competitive compensation
Paid holidays, vacation, and sick time
Generous medical, dental, and vision insurance
Employer matched 401k
Certification/professional development
Semi-annual in-person events
Remote WFH position

About Us

Flickerbox is a trusted partner for leading companies in Silicon Valley and around the world. We solve mission critical business needs with thoughtful code and design. We work in close concert with our clients to expand on their marketing strategies and improve their ability to execute and meet their goals. Our clients include innovative companies like Checkr, Instacart, Airship, Stitch Fix, and BlueJeans.

full_text: REMOTE - Senior React Engineer, CyberCoders, Seattle, WA, Remote, $150K/yr - $225K/yr, Hide job, Actively recruiting, 1 week ago, 7 applicants, Easy Apply
details:
If you are Senior React Engineer who wants to work on Mobile apps, please read on!

Job Title: Senior/Lead React Engineer (Who wants to work with React Native)

Salary: Competitive Base + Equity, Benefits

Permanently Remote

Backed by the same folks behind Lime, Shift, Forward, Square, Instacart, Twilio, OpenDoor & SpaceX.

We are building the next generation of mental health care by leveraging data from IoT devices (e.g. smartphones, wearables) to offer truly personalized therapy experiences.

Our founder was on the early team at Calm, Oura & Akili (all $1B+ mental health companies) & understands how to translate raw sensor data from patients' smartphones into insights and predictions our therapists will use to guide treatment.

We've already signed 6 of the 7 largest insurance companies in the country at much higher pay rates than our competitors!

This role is an opportunity to work with learn and work with React Native while getting to work side-by-side with the CEO to build new systems that save lives.

We're looking for a seasoned mobile engineer to take ownership of our mobile applications (built primarily with React Native), to change the way therapy is delivered across the United States.

If you have this experience, please apply immediately. We are actively interviewing this week and next for this high-profile position.

What's In It for You
You are creating from close to scratch (we have an MVP)
Significant Equity (full percentage point(s))
Competitive Compensation D.O.E.
Working with a technical CEO & building on a modern tech stack
Mission driven company and culture
Top Tier Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision 100% covered for employee)
Work remotely with Equipment & Supplies Paid for, Monthly Wellness Spend, Continuous Learning Spend
What You Need for this Position

Required
Must be willing to learn and work with React Native
5+ years of experience as a software engineer.
Prior startup experience at a fast-growing, early-stage, technology company.
2+ years of experience releasing an application on iOS and Android.
2+ years of experience writing JavaScript code regardless of the flavor, i.e., TypeScript.
Preferred
Experience building mobile applications for a healthcare company, including handling sensitive patient data and ensuring HIPAA compliance.
Experience doing passive data collection from users using iOS and Android applications.
Love the experience of autonomy, mastery, and purpose that comes with joining a fast-moving startup and owning the mobile application experience.
So, if you are a Senior React Engineer with experience, please apply today!

Colorado employees will receive paid sick leave. For additional information about available benefits, please contact Taylor McAlister

Email Your Resume In Word To

Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:

Taylor.McAlister@CyberCoders.com
Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : TM4-1718086L081 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***
Taylor McAlister - Sr. Executive Recruiter - CyberCoders

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

full_text: Senior Software Engineer - Trust & Safety, Checkr, Inc., United States, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, +3 benefits, Hide job, 1 alum works here, 4 days ago, 8 applicants, Easy Apply
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join their team that is highly collaborative and cares deeply about the mission of our company, is eager to work with a diverse team of engineers and has a quality-focused mindset. In this role, the Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for integration of the recently acquired background checks solution into Tessera in the near future, working on the data vendor integrations and evolving it into the identity verification platform long-term. The background check solution currently contains several public APIs, public and internal portals, and a handful of microservices. To be successful, this individual will work on integrating the acquired background check product into the Tessera ecosystem and will work on turning it into a solid foundation to build a complex identity verification solution.

Responsibilities:
Own the product development from ideation, design, implementation, to release
Partner with the technical lead in designing and architecting new systems
Collaborate with the technical lead and remote team in implementation
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
Deliver performant, reliable, scalable, and secure code

What you bring:
5+ years experience as a software engineer working with .NET
Experience designing and implementing REST APIs
Experience building lambda based applications on AWS
Experience building CI/CD using Serverless, Cloudformation, Terraform or similar
Experience building asynchronous processing pipelines using message queuing systems such as AWS SQS/SNS, RabbitMQ, Kafka or similar
Experience working with both RDBMS and NoSQL data stores such as SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB
A strong understanding of microservice architecture infrastructure, inclusive of familiarity with Kubernetes
A passion for optimizing services for scale and speed

What You Get:
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to $25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado and New York law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $122,103-$143,650 and within the city limits of NYC is $143,650 - $169,000.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr
Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr's commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

full_text: Staff Engineer, Live Routes, Veho, United States, Remote, Medical, Vision, Dental, 401(k), Hide job, 2 alumni work here, 2 weeks ago, 1 applicant
details:
About Veho

Veho's mission is to revolutionize the world of package delivery by creating exceptional experiences for customers and drivers.

For too long, parcel delivery companies have focused solely on efficiencies and cost-management. Veho focuses on the end-customer. As the first technology company of its kind, Veho replaces the old delivery trucks with a platform of crowdsourced drivers and a network of hyper-local delivery stations. We partner with some of the most recognized consumer brands such as Warby Parker and Hello Fresh to provide an incredible experience with every delivery, and give customers control on how, when and where their package is delivered.

Customers LOVE us. Despite growing at a record-speed over the past two years, we maintain an incredibly high customer satisfaction rating of 4.9/5 stars, and an unprecedented on-time delivery rate of 99.9% - far above every other company in the country.

In short, we are building the logistics platform of the future.

Veho is backed by former top executives and board members at Uber, FedEx, UPS, eBay and Amazon, three former public company CEOs, early investors in Lyft and Instacart, as well as prominent venture capital firms General Catalyst, Tiger Global, and Softbank. We are a team of leaders who are passionate about building an incredible company that will change the face of this industry.

About The Role

As a Staff Engineer on the Live Routes engineering team, you will lead a team working on the core systems and applications which power Veho's delivery operations platform. You will build friendly, delightful, and optimized experience for our Driver Partners, which power successful outcomes for end consumers.

What You'll Be Doing

Architecting, building, testing, and deploying applications, APIs and features for our contract driver, customer, client, and operations user bases
Modifying designs and specifications of complex applications.
Collaborating and adding value through participation in peer code reviews, providing comments and suggestions
Working with technical and non-technical end-users, other engineers, and product managers in a cross functional, quick moving, and collaborative environment
Analyzing code, requirements, system risks, and software reliability and providing recommendations on how to leverage our technology more efficiently
Working with Product and Design to confirm requirements, prioritization, and development of new features

Skills And Experience You'll Need To Have

Has 7+ years of experience building, testing, and deploying applications in high-traffic production environments
Has 7+ years of experience in full-stack software development (ideally with Javascript, Node.js , and React)
Enjoys taking initiative, is a self-starter, and is excited about collaborating on big challenges
Enthusiastic about working closely with product and operations team members to develop creative solutions to never-before-solved problems

Tech Stack

AWS lambda and other serverless technologies
Node.js
Javascript/Typescript
React
React Native

What We Value

Human - You value human dignity and treat others with respect. You value everyone as a unique individual no matter their role, seniority, or expertise.
Ownership - You take 100% responsibility for the areas you are accountable for, and support others to succeed in theirs.
Team Success - You recognize that the team’s success is your personal success. You support others through open-mindedness and transparency, and actively seek the best solution even if that isn’t your own.
Candor - You relentlessly pursue personal growth and are open & honest about your own shortcomings. You provide authentic, candid feedback to your peers, and welcome the same in return.

Why You Want to Work with Veho

Competitive Salary
Equity in a super fast-growing start-up
Full Suite of Benefits - Health Insurance (medical, dental, vision), 401K
Unlimited PTO
Team meetups, and much more!

The starting salary for this role is $176,634. The actual salary is dependent upon many factors, such as: education, experience, and skills. The pay range is subject to the discretion of the Company.

Veho is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Veho offers a generous ownership package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Veho employee shares one galvanizing mission: to revolutionize the world of package delivery by creating exceptional experiences for customers and drivers. We are deeply value-driven (Ownership, Candor, Team Success, Human) and care tremendously about investing in people. We are committed to creating a diverse team and an environment that provides everyone with the opportunity to do the work of their lifetime. Veho is unable to provide sponsorship at this time. Applicants must be able to understand and effectively communicate orally and in writing with all parties regarding work matters, which are generally conducted in English. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

As a Staff Engineer on the Live Routes engineering team, you will lead a team working on the core systems and applications which power Veho's delivery operations platform. position: Tessera Data - Senior Database Reliability Engineer
full_text: Tessera Data - Senior Database Reliability Engineer, Checkr, Inc., San Diego, CA, Medical, Vision, Dental, Hide job, 1 alum works here, 1 week ago, 4 applicants
details:
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

This position is for our Tessera Data business, which is focused on building a safer future, online and offline, by providing valuable people data to drive informed trust and safety decisions. Our industry-leading data serves as the backbone for background checks used to protect a company’s employees, customers, and community.

We are looking for a Senior Database Reliability Engineer, in this role you will provide key expertise in the automation, monitoring, and alerting of data resources. You will also be assisting engineering teams in database performance enhancements, as well as maintenance of our databases, servers, and database applications to ensure a consistent, uninterrupted experience for our accounts.

What a Typical Week May Look Like At Tessera
Work with the best and talented people
Manage cloud infrastructure related to database systems
Automate manual tasks associated with database systems
Automate monitoring and alerting for database systems and infrastructure
Manage user database access across multiple database systems
Build, test, and manage DR and HA plans
Review, identify and suggest best practices for performance tuning of poorly performing queries
Perform database and systems related code reviews
Make recommendations and implement emerging database technologies (No SQL, Relational...)
Participate in on-call rotation
Design databases and architecture to support business applications, ensuring system scalability, security, performance, and reliability

What We Value In a Database Reliability Engineer
5+ years of progressive work related experience with Data Operations, Engineering, and Administration Experience working with cloud managed database services, AWS and/or Azure
Experience with managing AWS networking including VPCs, Subnets, and Security Groups
Experience with writing Infrastructure as Code using Terraform
Experience with management of data pipelines
Experience with managing AWS security model
Experience with managing virtual machines used as database server hosts
Experience in High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for MS SQL Server including AlwaysOn, Clustering, Log Shipping and SQL Replication
Experience in Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO), using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools
Experience in data warehouse administration and design concepts
Ability to perform T-SQL, BCP, ETL, SSIS development and coding best practices
Ability to perform and automate scheduled database maintenance (updates, patches, shrinking and moving of files/logs, archiving data, and reindexing)
Ability to assist engineering teams in identifying and tuning poorly performing queries
Ability to assist engineering teams with data analysis

What You Get
A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to 25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend
The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $129,328 - $152,150.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Tessera

Tessera is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Tessera believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Tessera also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Tessera's commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Tessera

Tessera is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Tessera believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

We are looking for a Senior Database Reliability Engineer, in this role you will provide key expertise in the automation, monitoring, and alerting of data resources. What a Typical Week May Look Like At Tessera
Work with the best and talented people

Automate manual tasks associated with database systems
Automate monitoring and alerting for database systems and infrastructure
Manage user database access across multiple database systems
Build, test, and manage DR and HA plans
Review, identify and suggest best practices for performance tuning of poorly performing queries
Perform database and systems related code reviews
Make recommendations and implement emerging database technologies (No SQL, Relational...)
Participate in on-call rotation
Design databases and architecture to support business applications, ensuring system scalability, security, performance, and reliability

What We Value In a Database Reliability Engineer
5+ years of progressive work related experience with Data Operations, Engineering, and Administration Experience working with cloud managed database services, AWS and/or Azure
Experience with managing AWS networking including VPCs, Subnets, and Security Groups
Experience with writing Infrastructure as Code using Terraform
Experience with management of data pipelines
Experience with managing AWS security model
Experience with managing virtual machines used as database server hosts
Experience in High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for MS SQL Server including AlwaysOn, Clustering, Log Shipping and SQL Replication
Experience in Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO), using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools
Experience in data warehouse administration and design concepts
Ability to perform T-SQL, BCP, ETL, SSIS development and coding best practices
Ability to perform and automate scheduled database maintenance (updates, patches, shrinking and moving of files/logs, archiving data, and reindexing)
Ability to assist engineering teams in identifying and tuning poorly performing queries
Ability to assist engineering teams with data analysis
